[{'created': '2018-06-11 10:21:44.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent "server migrate --wait" from hanging

Migrate uses the same mechanism in the backend than Resize and so the
steps and step names are similar. Currently when using the --wait
option with 'migrate', we wait forever because the status won't get to
active until the user performs an action. This makes it return on
verify_resize status just like 'resize' does, so that the user can
perform the next manual step.

Change-Id: Ie1aeac52506bc8801f88fd6a6eb4f6094cf20050
Story: 2001994
Task: 19620
(cherry picked from commit 814ffb2a6f22aed640ba6adad62c1288f917b09a)

commit_message:
Prevent "server migrate --wait" from hanging

Migrate uses the same mechanism in the backend than Resize and so the
steps and step names are similar. Currently when using the --wait
option with 'migrate', we wait forever because the status won't get to
active until the user performs an action. This makes it return on
verify_resize status just like 'resize' does, so that the user can
perform the next manual step.

Change-Id: Ie1aeac52506bc8801f88fd6a6eb4f6094cf20050
Story: 2001994
Task: 19620
(cherry picked from commit 814ffb2a6f22aed640ba6adad62c1288f917b09a)

[{'created': '2018-06-07 10:45:56.000000000', 'message': 'Consolidate the setting of ironic-extra-vars

Only use a single shell task to set ironic-extra-vars in each playbook. In
the old project config directory these sections had names like
"ironic-deploy-with-IPA", "ironic-ipxe-disabled" ... but the names have been
lost so keeping them seperate make no sense.

Change-Id: I06176a1cb4a213670b04c5a0e7d8d4a1f3ee94e7
'}]
commit_message:
Consolidate the setting of ironic-extra-vars

Only use a single shell task to set ironic-extra-vars in each playbook. In
the old project config directory these sections had names like
"ironic-deploy-with-IPA", "ironic-ipxe-disabled" ... but the names have been
lost so keeping them seperate make no sense.

Change-Id: I06176a1cb4a213670b04c5a0e7d8d4a1f3ee94e7

commit_message:
Network Topology graph "twitches"

the graph is redrawn which causes visual glitching.
Depending on the graph complexity.

my patch resolved this issue so I compare between previous
data and received data, if that changed it will redrawn,
otherwise it keeps running.

Change-Id: I813dfb329f46cda9afacce89c9a8b84eb2827115
Closes-Bug: #1716834

messages:
[{'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2017-11-07 11:14:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26828, 'date': '2017-11-07 14:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8866, 'date': '2017-11-07 15:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-11-07 19:29:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I guess I still don't fully understand how this is useful. If a token can only be used with the account that created it, how would we tell the difference between a real call that reuses the token and someone taking over the token?"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2017-11-08 13:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22136, 'date': '2017-11-08 14:24:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-11-30 06:35:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Yes, I can understand the benefit.  a hashed auth_token can be used to tack and audit without leaking token.  We need a unit test for verifying hashed authon_token. others LGTM'}, {'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:05:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

This looks like a good change.

@dhellman - The change does not allow one to detect malicious activity, but it does allow for doing forensics if malicious activity is detected and you know that a particular token was stolen.  The hash can be used to determine what activities were performed using a particular token.

@gcb - It appears that there is already a test that was added in this patch, which checks that the token is not included in the logging values.  Are you suggesting that we validate that the correct hash is contained in the logging output instead of just checking if the real token value is omitted?'}, {'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:20:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9098, 'date': '2018-02-26 10:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-02-26 11:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2018-02-26 19:54:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Please use the Audit ID instead of the token ID for tracking.  Token should not go in the logs.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-02-27 08:36:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Adam, we don't have the Audit ID available here AFAIK."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-02-27 09:30:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Adam, I see what you mean now. There is apparently an audit_id and an audit_chain_id that's part of the token. that might be very useful actually. And should probably be logged. Where is that set? is that set in keystonemiddleware? is it unique per-token? Note that this doesn't log the token but it logs instead a hash of it, though, if we already have an id we can use, that would be great. However, it seems that here we don't really have a token object, but the string instead."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-06-13 10:07:21.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not pursuing this further'}]

[{'created': '2017-11-07 11:14:16.000000000', 'message': "Add option to output hashed auth_token

This adds the option to output a hashed version of the auth token
instead of the placeholder. This makes it possible to uniquely identify
the token.

The aforementioned option to get a hashed auth_token is useful in
auditing cases, and in attempting to spot malicious activity, as it
singles out a token that's used and allows for filtering based on that.
This way, even if a malicious actor manages to take over a token and
impersonate another user (by overwritting X-User-Id or similar fields)
we will still be able to spot that the same token was used.

commit_message:
Add option to output hashed auth_token

This adds the option to output a hashed version of the auth token
instead of the placeholder. This makes it possible to uniquely identify
the token.

The aforementioned option to get a hashed auth_token is useful in
auditing cases, and in attempting to spot malicious activity, as it
singles out a token that's used and allows for filtering based on that.
This way, even if a malicious actor manages to take over a token and
impersonate another user (by overwritting X-User-Id or similar fields)
we will still be able to spot that the same token was used.

Change-Id: Idc15283564243b33a8b9af3c97438ed8b2fc2d71

commit_message:
Update all SHAs for 17.0.6

This patch updates all the roles to the latest available stable
SHA's, copies the release notes from the updated roles into the
integrated repo, updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Depends-On: I058e76d2ec613aefcc5ea14703c285ece455dd39
Change-Id: I368946caa37052f7fdf0bbe03aaac3c482c6d4e1

messages:
[{'account_id': 27386, 'date': '2018-06-13 03:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-06-13 03:31:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Awesome, thanks so much for not only finding it and pushing a patch to fix it. Nice work!

The commit message will live in the repository permanently so it would be useful to be less generic and so we can tell exactly what the commit/patch does. See inline for more details.

Normally I'd just fix it, but wanted to first say thanks and didn't know how you'd feel about it, plus a chance to learn for the next awesome patch you contribute to Swift ;)"}, {'account_id': 27386, 'date': '2018-06-13 04:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-06-13 04:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-06-13 04:47:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

This is what I meant :)

It's still in your name. It's good to have a title and then some more info if relevant. That is you can't hit it all the shorter sentence.

See:   https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Summary_of_Git_commit_message_structure for more details"}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-06-13 07:52:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Add an optional flags sub-element to the release, with "forced" being
the only defined flag for now.

Set the forced flag for the searchlight deliverables for rocky.

commit_message:
fix vmware-nsx jobs

This patch adds neutron as a required project to the vmware-nsx project
jobs where applicable. It also creates a new job for lower constraints
to ensure the required projects are added.

For more details please see the discussion started in [1].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/

PyPI is now more strict about requiring README.rst files to be parseable. Failures to parse the readme block uploading new versions of packages, so we need to fix README.rst on new releases.

See http://logs.openstack.org/81/568881/4/check/openstack-tox-validate/89733ec/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-05-30_10_07_02_584707 for the errors'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-06-01 20:06:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-04 14:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Still an issue with the README formatting:

DEBUG: warning: check: Literal block expected; none found. (line 26)'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-06-05 12:59:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-05 13:41:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The commit hash will need to be updated to a new one that includes the fixes to the README file.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-06-07 11:19:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-06-07 11:36:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-07 11:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I'm a little confused how this passes now without changing the hash to include README fixes, but everything checks out OK now."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-07 11:58:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

Hash checks out, so I guess now I'm just confused why it failed before after the hash was updated, but oh well. Looks good to go."}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:24:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-06-08 07:20:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

> Hash checks out, so I guess now I'm just confused why it failed
 > before after the hash was updated, but oh well. Looks good to go.

I believe it failed because there was an issue in mistral-dashboard, I assume that repo is checked because it could be included in the release - but in this case it had no changes to be released.

I guess README only changes are not considered worthy of a release? I just use the tox env to re-generate this patch, expecting it to include mistral-dashboard. https://github.com/openstack/mistral-dashboard/commit/8667df40a9a0894652ba7bafec048df11256310f

This confused me for a while too :)"}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-06-08 07:58:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> Hey Dougal, is there a reason for needing to rebase this?

Sorry, I missed this. I was rebasing as a way to rechevk as I was trying to figure out what was failing.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-08 14:16:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

The new-release command has a bug. It is only updating the repos tagged in the most recent commit. common-tasks: test-set-nodepool-vars: Populate fact for EPEL mirror

improve the reliability of the CentOS jobs.

commit_message:
ensure the validation works when some repositories are not tagged

The validation logic for ensuring that semver is applied when
dependencies are updated did not take into account the fact that
sometimes we do not tag every repository in a deliverable. This change
tracks the previous version associated with each repository separately
so that if repos are added or removed from a deliverable over time the
validation rules can be applied correctly.

Change-Id: I8c911e6fb8a39b1d2ffb12a923a86eb9fe4beb26
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
support projects that use the python3 variation of the pypi job

During the transition phase projects may use either the
python2 (default) or python3 version of the pypi publshing jobs.

Change-Id: I2759696347f2226499b4a8b3ee7dfa0d2c06c310
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove hardcode to openstack from required_platform validator

This validator is one of the general one. Despite the fact, it is not
directly hardcoded to OpenStack plaform, it's interface was desgined to
openstack credentials and usage of it for non-openstack platforms looks
ugly.

This patch changes it's behaviour to check existance of the platform in
the environemnt spec for main case + searchs&re-calls
required_platfrom@platform_name for custom logic like checking
admin/user credentials.

Change-Id: I546bbd9b0e35abb30195b0f8c98756a9cce10107

commit_message:
[plugins] Simplify usage of plugins with "default" platform

Make Plugin.get return a plugin with "default" platfrom in case of
MultipleMatch and `platform is None` condition.

Change-Id: I9a77c3e894d7c1eadf77dc6de8e1d9a6839202a4

commit_message:
Fix bootloader packages for rhel

When using uefi in rhel, the package mapping is incorrect.
We need to add specific grub-efi* mappings to use grub2-efi

Change-Id: I2db96ae85fd5e4638c794015b2f8164c018420e3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 15:02:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I985f87faefbe1b503b502c98acf0ed6003c587ad
'}]
commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I985f87faefbe1b503b502c98acf0ed6003c587ad

Currently, the new test fails (locally on my environment, at least), for the following reason:
pip 10 removed 'pip.req'.
ryu uses 'pip.req' up to 4.24 (but lower-requirement is 4.14).

@Doug - what's the correct solution? Is there a way to lower-constrain pip version, or do we have to bump pip to 4.24? Or something else?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-10 19:22:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Currently, the new test fails (locally on my environment, at
 > least), for the following reason:
 > pip 10 removed 'pip.req'.
 > ryu uses 'pip.req' up to 4.24 (but lower-requirement is 4.14).
 > 
 > @Doug - what's the correct solution? Is there a way to
 > lower-constrain pip version, or do we have to bump pip to 4.24? Or
 > something else?

Great question!

I don't think we can constrain pip. If the newest versions of pip do not work, I think that means you're going to need to make some code changes somewhere. It's not clear why anything would need pip code at runtime, so I can't really give more specific advice about what to do.

Does a newer ryu work?"}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-05-29 13:23:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Newer ryu works (as in the py* unit tests and fullstack tests).

I guess we have to raise ryu's minimum version to avoid the collision with pip."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-05-29 17:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Newer ryu works (as in the py* unit tests and fullstack tests).
 > 
 > I guess we have to raise ryu's minimum version to avoid the
 > collision with pip.

That sounds like it would work. When I proposed all of these patches I asked teams to take them over and ask for help if they needed it when fixing them, because I had so many of them to manage.

Do you want to take this patch over and try the newer ryu?"}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-05-30 06:59:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sure. No worries. I'll see what I can do."}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-05-30 07:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-05-31 08:59:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-06-12 08:07:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 17880, 'date': '2018-06-12 08:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 20229, 'date': '2018-06-12 12:58:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23766, 'date': '2018-06-13 06:31:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

[{'created': '2018-06-10 13:50:45.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Initial refactoring of ZMQ pubsub

To work around the ZMQ issues (publisher binds to a port, thus only one
publisher can work on a given IP), we had a lot of junk code in our
repo.
Removed all redundant mechanisms (use_multiproc, is_neutron_server) and
modified to have 2 types of configurable ZMQ drivers:
1. zmq_remote_pubsub_driver - Has TCP publisher and IPC subscriber, This
   should be used in the publisher service.
2. zmq_pubsub_driver - Has IPC publisher and TCP subscriberi, This
   should be used in all other uses.

The way to set the one to use is via configuration, thus it is up to the
deployment to make sure this is configured correctly.

Change-Id: Ibf7894e608187e87bdeb7774749bfa0cc15eae56

commit_message:
Refactoring of ZMQ pubsub

To work around the ZMQ issues (publisher binds to a port, thus only one
publisher can work on a given IP), we had a lot of junk code in our
repo.
Removed all redundant mechanisms (use_multiproc, is_neutron_server) and
modified to have 2 types of configurable ZMQ drivers:
1. zmq_remote_pubsub_driver - Has TCP publisher and IPC subscriber, This
   should be used in the publisher service.
2. zmq_pubsub_driver - Has IPC publisher and TCP subscriberi, This
   should be used in all other uses.

The way to set the one to use is via configuration, thus it is up to the
deployment to make sure this is configured correctly.

Change-Id: Ibf7894e608187e87bdeb7774749bfa0cc15eae56

commit_message:
Use user specified private key when deleting temp keys

We use the user specified private key when we inject the temporary ssh
key, and we should also use it when we delete the temprorary ssh keys.
Even though this script is no longer used on master, we should commit
this so we can backport to queens.

Change-Id: Id389984b87209f959e4cf439abd8165a3a08ead3
Closes-Bug: #1773980

if centos image is used, which is the default value.

commit_message:
Set the initial introspection attempt to 0

When it was set to 1, it meant that we done one less retry than
expected. 0 retries meant 0 attempts (an an error). So now 0 retries
should mean the initial attempt and no retries. We have been running one
less introspection attempt than we previously claimed.

Closes-Bug: #1753784
Change-Id: I4e9485e6b11daf2a44cba114e97fdce582258f1e

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131233.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 06:27:07.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I2d0463551f29d43af513a3821fea873ac0e058dc
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I2d0463551f29d43af513a3821fea873ac0e058dc

commit_message:
Check if a bridge with name br-int exists

br-int is the name reserved for the ovs bridge connecting the instances
to the hypervisors. Names of ovs-bridges deployed by tripleo should not
conflict with this.

Change-Id: I5a8c1ecbf6dac4de5d6348f6c5e055958cd5f553

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-21 14:15:10.000000000', 'message': "ovs-dpdk: allow dpdk-driver value 'none'

Some NICs do not work with vfi-pci or uio_pci_generic. E.g. mxl4/mlx5
which uses relies on the OFED or Kernel drivers (post 4.14).
In this cases we don't want to generate entries in /etc/dpdk/inerfaces.

Here we introduce a new value for 'dpdk-driver' configuration 'none'. If
used the charm will omit adding entries in the aforementioned file.

Change-Id: I2fb9f0404adbbee0f298729467794e172bae2d98
Signed-off-by: Nikolay Nikolaev <nikolay.nikolaev@canonical.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-05-21 16:00:54.000000000', 'message': "ovs-dpdk: allow dpdk-driver value 'none'

Some NICs do not work with vfi-pci or uio_pci_generic. E.g. mxl4/mlx5
which uses relies on the OFED or Kernel drivers (post 4.14).
In this cases we don't want to generate entries in /etc/dpdk/inerfaces.

Here we introduce a new value for 'dpdk-driver' configuration 'none'. If
used the charm will omit adding entries in the aforementioned file.

Change-Id: I2fb9f0404adbbee0f298729467794e172bae2d98
Signed-off-by: Nikolay Nikolaev <nikolay.nikolaev@canonical.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-05-23 07:04:59.000000000', 'message': "ovs-dpdk: change dpdk-driver default to None

Some NICs do not work with vfi-pci or uio_pci_generic. E.g. mxl4/mlx5
which uses relies on the OFED or Kernel drivers (post 4.14).
In this cases we don't want to generate entries in /etc/dpdk/inerfaces.

Here we change the configuration processing behavior. The charm will omit
adding entries in the aforementioned file when the value is not set.

The default value is changed to empty (i.e. None)

Change-Id: I2fb9f0404adbbee0f298729467794e172bae2d98

Here we change the configuration processing behavior. The charm will omit
adding entries in the aforementioned file when the value is not set.

The default value is changed to empty (i.e. None)

Change-Id: I2fb9f0404adbbee0f298729467794e172bae2d98
"}]
commit_message:
ovs-dpdk: change dpdk-driver default to None

Some NICs do not work with vfi-pci or uio_pci_generic. E.g. mxl4/mlx5
which uses relies on the OFED or Kernel drivers (post 4.14).
In this cases we don't want to generate entries in /etc/dpdk/inerfaces.

Here we change the configuration processing behavior. The charm will omit
adding entries in the aforementioned file when the value is not set.

The default value is changed to empty (i.e. None)

Change-Id: I2fb9f0404adbbee0f298729467794e172bae2d98

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 07:04:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race condition in device tag testing

Device tag tests (test_device_tagging.py) has hard coded
sleep with default cache time of metadata service. That cache
time is configurable on nova side (metadata_cache_expiration).

So instead of sleep with hard code value, we should go with the wait
loop to fetch the metadata info for verification. For safer side,
build_timeout is being used as max time to fetch the expected metadata
info otherwise test will fail with timeout.

Change-Id: Ic59a12f3fbcb7ef1972c03cb0c92d08a0a35498b
Closes-Bug: #1775491
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in device tag testing

Device tag tests (test_device_tagging.py) has hard coded
sleep with default cache time of metadata service. That cache
time is configurable on nova side (metadata_cache_expiration).

So instead of sleep with hard code value, we should go with the wait
loop to fetch the metadata info for verification. For safer side,
build_timeout is being used as max time to fetch the expected metadata
info otherwise test will fail with timeout.

Change-Id: Ic59a12f3fbcb7ef1972c03cb0c92d08a0a35498b
Closes-Bug: #1775491

commit_message:
Run integration tests serially

it seems the softwareconfig_list_software_deployments is being racy
as it time to time gets other than expected value for server.id
in the first item if software deployments list
(kind of expected if there are other tests that create software
deployments).

commit_message:
[Grenade] Switch base to stable/queens

We should test two neighbour branches in grenade job.
So, after branching of stable/queens we should use it as
base for testing of manila migration to current master
branch (Rocky-dev).

Change-Id: I20a78d69b4adcedd2e1691c7ef672567826a6b79

commit_message:
Skip ServerShowV254Test.test_rebuild_server in cells v1 job

This adds yet another rebuild test to the blacklist for the
cells v1 job. Rebuild status updates are racy in the cells v1
job because of the async status updates.

Change-Id: I42f08ee2a7282c9cad761bbe0daa111e79678791
Related-Bug: #1709985

commit_message:
use CORE constant from neutron-lib plugins

commit_message:
Switch to cryptography from pycrypto

PyCrypto isn't active developed for quite a while, cryptography is
recommended instead. This patch does this migration, but still keeps
pycrytpo as a fallback solution.

Random generation is also migrated to os.urandom as the cryptography
document suggests:
https://cryptography.io/en/latest/random-numbers/

Closes-Bug: #1749574

Change-Id: I5c0c1a238023c116af5a84d899e629f1c7c3513f
Co-Authored-By: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>
Signed-off-by: Zhao Chao <zhaochao1984@gmail.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-06-13 04:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-06-13 05:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-06-13 05:50:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 04:54:34.000000000', 'message': "Skip released that are close but not fully EOLd when building wheels

The requirements project is very slow to actually tag branches as EOLd as
that can cause some testing environments and devstack to fail.  For
example if tox.ini refers to a constraints file in git[1].

However building wheels for those releases isn't actually helpful as
they're not chnaging *and* can cause failed runs as pypi etc move on.

This change adds an regex for the closed branches to exclude them from
building.  The regex is a little more complex than the single case
(newton) requires but allows for easier future additions.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/tox.ini?h=newton-eol#n12

Change-Id: Ia0c589989cb6e7e81e7b08e39d81dac78c55bf18
"}]
commit_message:
Skip released that are close but not fully EOLd when building wheels

The requirements project is very slow to actually tag branches as EOLd as
that can cause some testing environments and devstack to fail.  For
example if tox.ini refers to a constraints file in git[1].

However building wheels for those releases isn't actually helpful as
they're not chnaging *and* can cause failed runs as pypi etc move on.

This change adds an regex for the closed branches to exclude them from
building.  The regex is a little more complex than the single case
(newton) requires but allows for easier future additions.

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/tree/tox.ini?h=newton-eol#n12

Change-Id: Ia0c589989cb6e7e81e7b08e39d81dac78c55bf18

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 13:48:19.000000000', 'message': "Improve ssh connection handling

In some environments, config-download was failing with unreachable
errors from ssh. The root causes could vary due to environmental and
hardware differences, especially since we are using ansible to restart
network interfaces and restart sshd on the managed nodes. Different
environments could respond to these tasks differently.

To make the ssh connections resilient, this patch does 3 things:
- adds ssh retries set to 8
- increases the ControlPersist timeout to 30 minutes
- descreases the ssh connect timeout to 30 seconds so we fail and retry
  faster

With these changes, we've seen improvements in environments that were
exhibiting issues.

Change-Id: I0c9adf9fdff0edfee5cc1733d9e31039ec0f8986
Partial-Bug: #1773837
"}, {'created': '2018-06-11 12:13:22.000000000', 'message': "Improve ssh connection handling

In some environments, config-download was failing with unreachable
errors from ssh. The root causes could vary due to environmental and
hardware differences, especially since we are using ansible to restart
network interfaces and restart sshd on the managed nodes. Different
environments could respond to these tasks differently.

To make the ssh connections resilient, this patch does 3 things:
- adds ssh retries set to 8
- increases the ControlPersist timeout to 30 minutes
- descreases the ssh connect timeout to 30 seconds so we fail and retry
  faster

With these changes, we've seen improvements in environments that were
exhibiting issues.

Change-Id: I0c9adf9fdff0edfee5cc1733d9e31039ec0f8986
Partial-Bug: #1773837
"}]
commit_message:
Improve ssh connection handling

In some environments, config-download was failing with unreachable
errors from ssh. The root causes could vary due to environmental and
hardware differences, especially since we are using ansible to restart
network interfaces and restart sshd on the managed nodes. Different
environments could respond to these tasks differently.

To make the ssh connections resilient, this patch does 3 things:
- adds ssh retries set to 8
- increases the ControlPersist timeout to 30 minutes
- descreases the ssh connect timeout to 30 seconds so we fail and retry
  faster

With these changes, we've seen improvements in environments that were
exhibiting issues.

Change-Id: I0c9adf9fdff0edfee5cc1733d9e31039ec0f8986
Partial-Bug: #1773837

commit_message:
Remove PyPI downloads

According to official site,
https://packaging.python.org/guides/analyzing-pypi-package-downloads/
PyPI package download statistics is no longer maintained and thus
should be removed.

Change-Id: Id4c5d19aa664ddc94ce108467bf92721eb33747e

commit_message:
Convert missing exception on device.link.delete()

Once we started using oslo.privsep the call to device.link.delete()
should return RuntimeError when the device can't be handled by ip link
for example, when it's an ovs internal device.

Closes-Bug: #1776469

Change-Id: Ibf4b0bbb54aef38fc569036880668c745cb5c096

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 13:56:03.000000000', 'message': 'Change consecutive build failure limit to a weigher

There is concern over the ability for compute nodes to reasonably
determine which events should count against its consecutive build
failures. Since the compute may erronenously disable itself in
response to mundane or otherwise intentional user-triggered events,
this patch adds a scheduler weigher that considers the build failure
counter and can negatively weigh hosts with recent failures. This
avoids taking computes fully out of rotation, rather treating them as
less likely to be picked for a subsequent scheduling
operation.

This introduces a new conf option to control this weight. The default
is set high to maintain the existing behavior of picking nodes that
are not experiencing high failure rates, and resetting the counter as
soon as a single successful build occurs. This is minimal visible
change from the existing behavior with default configuration.

The rationale behind the default value for this weigher comes from the
values likely to be generated by its peer weighers. The RAM and Disk
weighers will increase the score by number of available megabytes of
memory (range in thousands) and disk (range in millions). The default
value of 1000000 for the build failure weigher will cause competing
nodes with similar amounts of available disk and a small (less than ten)
number of failures to become less desirable than those without, even
with many terabytes of available disk.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py

NOTE(danms): The conflict was due to not having change
I16ba29385dd2db5467829e6c17fc395096b5cfd3 in Queens.

Change-Id: I71c56fe770f8c3f66db97fa542fdfdf2b9865fb8
Related-Bug: #1742102
(cherry picked from commit 91e29079a0eac825c5f4fe793cf607cb1771467d)
'}, {'created': '2018-06-07 14:18:03.000000000', 'message': 'Change consecutive build failure limit to a weigher

There is concern over the ability for compute nodes to reasonably
determine which events should count against its consecutive build
failures. Since the compute may erronenously disable itself in

this patch adds a scheduler weigher that considers the build failure

avoids taking computes fully out of rotation, rather treating them as

operation.

This introduces a new conf option to control this weight. The default
is set high to maintain the existing behavior of picking nodes that
are not experiencing high failure rates, and resetting the counter as
soon as a single successful build occurs. This is minimal visible
change from the existing behavior with default configuration.

The rationale behind the default value for this weigher comes from the
values likely to be generated by its peer weighers. The RAM and Disk
weighers will increase the score by number of available megabytes of
memory (range in thousands) and disk (range in millions). The default
value of 1000000 for the build failure weigher will cause competing
nodes with similar amounts of available disk and a small (less than ten)
number of failures to become less desirable than those without, even
with many terabytes of available disk.

Change-Id: I71c56fe770f8c3f66db97fa542fdfdf2b9865fb8
Related-Bug: #1742102
(cherry picked from commit 91e29079a0eac825c5f4fe793cf607cb1771467d)
'}]
commit_message:
Change consecutive build failure limit to a weigher

There is concern over the ability for compute nodes to reasonably
determine which events should count against its consecutive build
failures. Since the compute may erronenously disable itself in
response to mundane or otherwise intentional user-triggered events,
this patch adds a scheduler weigher that considers the build failure
counter and can negatively weigh hosts with recent failures. This
avoids taking computes fully out of rotation, rather treating them as
less likely to be picked for a subsequent scheduling
operation.

This introduces a new conf option to control this weight. The default
is set high to maintain the existing behavior of picking nodes that
are not experiencing high failure rates, and resetting the counter as
soon as a single successful build occurs. This is minimal visible
change from the existing behavior with default configuration.

The rationale behind the default value for this weigher comes from the
values likely to be generated by its peer weighers. The RAM and Disk
weighers will increase the score by number of available megabytes of
memory (range in thousands) and disk (range in millions). The default
value of 1000000 for the build failure weigher will cause competing
nodes with similar amounts of available disk and a small (less than ten)
number of failures to become less desirable than those without, even
with many terabytes of available disk.

Change-Id: I71c56fe770f8c3f66db97fa542fdfdf2b9865fb8
Related-Bug: #1742102
(cherry picked from commit 91e29079a0eac825c5f4fe793cf607cb1771467d)

commit_message:
fix release-openstack-python3 so it does what we mean

Import the python-tarball playbook from openstack-zuul-jobs and call
it pti-python-tarball to reflect the fact that it honors the OpenStack
Python Testing Interface.

Redefine release-openstack-python3 to use the new pti-python-tarball
playbook instead of inheriting from release-openstack-python, because
the old job uses the old python-tarball playbook which does not honor
the release_python variable.

Change-Id: Ic6c1da3e05d3fc59700ed97e1e5aafa3196d9fb6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-13 00:23:48.000000000', 'message': 'package-afs-centos: fix final copy

This is currently copying everything into

 https://tarballs.openstack.org/project-config/package-afs-centos7/x86_64/

where we don't actually want the "x86_64".  Add trailing slash so it
copies the directory contents.  Also remove any existing content with
--delete, we only want the latest.

Change-Id: I4b0fe994baaaf04db0fe552f88107d90e328f048
'}]
commit_message:
package-afs-centos: fix final copy

This is currently copying everything into

 https://tarballs.openstack.org/project-config/package-afs-centos7/x86_64/

where we don't actually want the "x86_64".  Add trailing slash so it
copies the directory contents.  Also remove any existing content with
--delete, we only want the latest.

commit_message:
Read-only middleware fixups

- Expose cluster-wide read-only status in /info
- Use a set instead of list for write_methods
- Provide a more explicit response when returning 405
- Consider self.read_only in account_read_only
- Use return_values instead of callables for more mocks

Change-Id: I45387067a69919706800df3a8ca12ae8f5d16d90

[{'created': '2018-06-08 06:27:08.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that

'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idcd4f83677bc9d2a936b95ad84fd06c663a9bdd1

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iee6d84803d7a36771e0bb632464d2a7799550c0e

commit_message:
Remove a check for docker proxy task

This patch set will allow the docker setting to take effect even if
docker is already installed. The proxy setting will take effect as
long as the proxy variables are in place.

Change-Id: I1df812001d37d094fc3a31bea9e13d1488277a67
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Move ansible to virtualenv in kolla_toolbox

Now the ansible and its python dependencies are installed on system. It
may be failed to install in some case. This patch installs python
packages in virtualenv for kolla_toolbox image.

Closes-Bug: #1771717
Change-Id: I3c4465d5dfe4f909521fa00173f1cf8d9eec783f
(cherry picked from commit ce31fa4b1c85de4c21ffb63f3cf58e02bfd3d0a4)

subject: Get rid of tpool_reraise
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2017-11-09 19:25:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-05-15 21:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-05-22 17:31:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-22 17:55:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

There are behavioral differences in a couple cases. Eventlet catches and re-raises (Exception, Timeout) whereas we catch and re-raise BaseException. If we don't raise any exceptions that are BaseExceptions but aren't Exceptions or Timeouts, then this is fine. I guess that would be old-style classes only, so it's probably okay unless something in stdlib does it.

Also, Eventlet will catch GeneratorExit, KeyboardInterrupt, and SystemExit and re-raise them *in the worker thread*. The last two are fine since a SIGINT sent to a process will be received by the main thread, so we don't have to worry about anything there, and we don't raise SystemExit anywhere that goes near a tpool. GeneratorExit is fine too.

I'm a little worried about things in stdlib raising old-style exceptions, but other than that it's probably fine."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-22 17:57:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Side note: Eventlet has not always done the right thing. Version 0.9.14 and below only reraised Exception, not Timeout.

Swift added 5db3cb3 on 11 April 2011, and Eventlet started catching Timeout on 12 April 2011. The fix was released in 0.9.15.

Swift currently requires eventlet >= 0.17.4, so we don't have to worry about old versions."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-05-22 19:08:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-05-22 21:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I looked around some, and the only things we call using tpool_reraise won't raise old-style exceptions. It's pretty much all diskfile stuff, and it's all going to raise OSError or IOError when things go wrong, so I think this is fine.

I was afraid we'd have HTTP stuff tpooled for some reason; there's old-style classes lurking in httplib."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-06-12 22:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-06-12 22:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-09 19:25:40.000000000', 'message': 'Log exceptions in tpool_reraise

...but do it *before* coming back out of the tpool. Previously, if you
had some badly-chosen config values (like reclaim_age=0) and some
long-running PUTs, your object-servers would log a bunch of 500s with
log lines like

Nov  9 19:02:11 saio object-6010: Error removing tempfile: /srv/node1/sdb1/tmp-1/tmpDykBYv:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/obj/diskfile.py", line 2647, in create
    os.unlink(tmppath)
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '/srv/node1/sdb1/tmp-1/tmpDykBYv' (txn: tx8e655128bc424659b203f-005a04a601)
...
Nov  9 19:02:11 saio object-6010: ERROR __call__ error with PUT /sdb1/249/AUTH_test/c2/o :
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/obj/server.py", line 1135, in __call__
    res = getattr(self, req.method)(req)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 1665, in _timing_stats
    resp = func(ctrl, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/obj/server.py", line 839, in PUT
    writer.put(metadata)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/obj/diskfile.py", line 2702, in put
    super(DiskFileWriter, self)._put(metadata, True)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/obj/diskfile.py", line 1660, in _put
    tpool_reraise(self._finalize_put, metadata, target_path, cleanup)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 3652, in tpool_reraise
    raise resp
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory (txn: tx8e655128bc424659b203f-005a04a601)

...since the replicator cleans up the temp directory for the upload
before the server finishes the write. Then you get very confused, as the
error that *seems* to be causing it is ignored (aside from the logging):
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/27398c357/swift/obj/diskfile.py#L2644-L2650

Now we can see the actual root cause for the error:

Nov  9 19:02:11 saio object-6010: STDERR: ERROR:root:Unhandled exception in tpool
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 3645, in inner
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/obj/diskfile.py", line 1603, in _finalize_put
    renamer(self._tmppath, target_path)
  File "/vagrant/swift/swift/common/utils.py", line 1247, in renamer
    os.rename(old, new)
OSError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory

Change-Id: Iad8109c4a03f006a89e55373cf3ca867d724b3e1
Related-Bug: 1647804
'}, {'created': '2018-05-22 17:31:13.000000000', 'message': 'Get rid of tpool_reraise

commit_message:
Get rid of tpool_reraise

As best I can tell, eventlet already does (and always has done) the
right thing, and we were just bad at catching Timeouts.

For some history:

    https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/5db3cb3
    https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/2b3aab8
    https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/da0e013

Change-Id: Iad8109c4a03f006a89e55373cf3ca867d724b3e1
Related-Bug: 1647804

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 14:37:11.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I35adb432bc130a2fe64095534c743faf1636b337
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I35adb432bc130a2fe64095534c743faf1636b337

commit_message:
Collect docker log in gate_hook

In before, we collect docker log in post_test_hook, but
post_test_hook will be executed only if all tests are passed.
This patch moves docker log collection from post_test_hook to
gate_hook, which allows us to collect docker log regardless of
the tests succeed or fail.

Change-Id: I1fb469d10520966145d338a8bc87aab4ba7adb5e

subject: Fix mismatched of timezone info
messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-06-09 20:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10206, 'date': '2018-06-12 11:25:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2018-06-13 02:26:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 20:08:36.000000000', 'message': "Fix mismatched of timezone info

We cannot compare between a datetime object with timezone
and a datetime object without timzone. For example,

a. Use oslo_utils.timeutils
a1. timeutils.utcnow(withtimezone=True) -> this creates a datetime
    object with timezone info
a2. timeutils.utcnow() -> this creates a datetime object without
    timezone info

b. Use oslo_versionedobjects.fields
b1. fields.DateTimeField() -> this defines a field that are aware
    of timezone info
b2. fields.DateTimeField(tzinfo_aware=False) -> this defines a field
    that are not aware of timezone info

We want to use either a1 + b1 or a2 + b2 to avoid issues due to
imcompatible datetime format. This patch implements a2 + b2 (a1 + b1
is suboptimal because it will break if the DB backend doesn't support
storing timezone info).

Change-Id: I2bb8ab6d027553bdc1188c5a9aacc4b3297e2a50
Closes-Bug: #1776018
"}]
commit_message:
Fix mismatched of timezone info

We cannot compare between a datetime object with timezone
and a datetime object without timzone. For example,

a. Use oslo_utils.timeutils
a1. timeutils.utcnow(withtimezone=True) -> this creates a datetime
    object with timezone info
a2. timeutils.utcnow() -> this creates a datetime object without
    timezone info

b. Use oslo_versionedobjects.fields
b1. fields.DateTimeField() -> this defines a field that are aware
    of timezone info
b2. fields.DateTimeField(tzinfo_aware=False) -> this defines a field
    that are not aware of timezone info

We want to use either a1 + b1 or a2 + b2 to avoid issues due to
imcompatible datetime format. This patch implements a2 + b2 (a1 + b1
is suboptimal because it will break if the DB backend doesn't support
storing timezone info).

Change-Id: I2bb8ab6d027553bdc1188c5a9aacc4b3297e2a50
Closes-Bug: #1776018

Add a policy rule to control if users can create a container
with specified 'runtime'. This is because the choice of runtime
has security implication so we would like to limit the privilege
of normal users to choose the container's runtime.

Change-Id: I711b5870c7c55bba3da4d369aa5ed3b0661075e8
"}]
commit_message:
Use policy for control the 'runtime' field

Add a policy rule to control if users can create a container
with specified 'runtime'. This is because the choice of runtime
has security implication so we would like to limit the privilege
of normal users to choose the container's runtime.

Change-Id: I711b5870c7c55bba3da4d369aa5ed3b0661075e8

You need to remove the depends-on for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569612/ and we can merge that then we could merge this one.  From a CI standpoint, the current relationship is backwards.  Ideally the other one would not have a depends-on and this would depends-on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569612/'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-06-12 07:58:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-06-12 16:07:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add 'host' parameter to image API

Require users to input the 'host' parameter when pulling and
deleting image because this is a mandatory parameter in server side.

Depends-On: Ie2edde77b7444e1025559b1aa1d67c9c8782620f

Implements: blueprint rework-image-api

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

networkx kept at 1.11 for breakage
  * bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1718576
google-auth and google-api-python-client kept at current for cinder breakage
  * bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1775218
eventlet kept at 0.20.0 for breakage
Sphinx kep at 1.6.5 for docs breakage
pyldap, removed post1 again
urllib3 is being held back because of requests
  * https://github.com/requests/requests/issues/4673
idna is being held back by requests as well
  * https://github.com/requests/requests/issues/4681
pexpect is being held back for ansible-runner
  * ansible/ansible-runner#44

Change-Id: I90626ff9d65ab0df875d2c5a2d058a472631f1b6

subject: Fix a potential IP address conflict
messages: [{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-06-07 20:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-06-08 18:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-06-12 18:25:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-06-12 23:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 20:31:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a potential IP address conflict

Previously the tests generated a random IP address (out of 90)
for each load balancer. As these tests run in parallel there was a
chance that two load balancers could be assigned the same address,
causing a conflict and randomly failing a test.

This patch changes the tests to use a neutron assigned address unless
an explicit "use_fixed_ip" flag is set.
The load balancer create API test uses this flag, the others will use
a neutron assigned address.

Change-Id: Ic22efd1df027fd7dd0db14783f2c76069fd51bb5
'}, {'created': '2018-06-08 18:05:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a potential IP address conflict

Previously the tests generated a random IP address (out of 90)
for each load balancer. As these tests run in parallel there was a
chance that two load balancers could be assigned the same address,
causing a conflict and randomly failing a test.

This patch changes the tests to use a neutron assigned address unless
an explicit "use_fixed_ip" flag is set.
The load balancer create API test uses this flag, the others will use
a neutron assigned address.

Change-Id: Ic22efd1df027fd7dd0db14783f2c76069fd51bb5
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a potential IP address conflict

Previously the tests generated a random IP address (out of 90)
for each load balancer. As these tests run in parallel there was a
chance that two load balancers could be assigned the same address,
causing a conflict and randomly failing a test.

This patch changes the tests to use a neutron assigned address unless
an explicit "use_fixed_ip" flag is set.
The load balancer create API test uses this flag, the others will use
a neutron assigned address.

Change-Id: Ic22efd1df027fd7dd0db14783f2c76069fd51bb5

Replace curly quotes with straight quotes

Curly quotes usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Improve force delete

* Drop use of stack abandon: just use a regular delete instead
* Return stack name from force delete API call

Change-Id: I33ee7323fade1b237957abb8f7c79b87eb20148f

subject: [VNX Cinder] Deprecate option storage_vnx_pool_name
messages:
[{'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2018-06-12 02:04:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-06-12 03:33:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-06-12 07:48:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We don't normally backport deprecations since this could potentially break current users? Do you see any issue forcing through a change of that config option for users?"}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2018-06-12 08:37:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> We don't normally backport deprecations since this could
 > potentially break current users? Do you see any issue forcing
 > through a change of that config option for users?

Red Hat OSP13 is using queens, users can not configure specific VNX pools for driver if no this patch backporting"}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-06-12 09:56:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

Ok, this assumes that changing from storage_vnx_pool_name config option to storage_vnx_pool_names being deployed. I guess this is fine but might break someone unless they have a setup supporting storage_vnx_pool_names option.

But I won't block since a Queens setup will probably be one later version of pretty much everything hopefully."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-06-12 20:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I437d90d2e8d7395cd7b6ca39d3c23c886c0f02b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 13:48:34.000000000', 'message': 'Move database creation into role (cinder)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I3127dd5ed980a41ac013757c78626e20ad62f93e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571724
'}, {'created': '2018-06-04 06:38:23.000000000', 'message': 'Move database creation into role (cinder)

commit_message:
Move database creation into role (cinder)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I3127dd5ed980a41ac013757c78626e20ad62f93e
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571724

commit_message:
Ceph-config-helper: Add rgwadmin python package

This adds the rgwadmin python package to the ceph config helper
image, allowing it to be used for creating s3 buckets for radosgw
to be used with elasticsearch

Change-Id: I2c633a4715ef1fdccd833cc8eeaefddbecb0cec4

commit_message:
DNM: test heartbeat code in pre_live_migration

This makes the heartbeat code run by making pre_live_migration
sleep for longer than the heartbeat interval so that the source
will have to ping it.

Change-Id: I51f49a085afd246260d5b9e11642906926791501

subject: Debian: use mod_wsgi for py3
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 12:12:37.000000000', 'message': 'Debian: use mod_wsgi for py3

Currently, libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 is selected in all the fixtures /
scenarios files. Not only this is bad (ie: this means puppet-openstack
users will have to also manually do it), but this also breaks the
scheduling, as default Apache files gets removed before the Apache wsgi
services are setup, then the keystone package installs the file,
meaning that at the 2nd run, the CI believes the run is not indempotent.

So, this patch adds libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 selection when running with
Debian packages, before we can remove this from fixtures/scenario00X.pp
files.

Change-Id: Ib9d0e34dbf18bb84313fd319f787fb8be873a695
'}]
commit_message:
Debian: use mod_wsgi for py3

Currently, libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 is selected in all the fixtures /
scenarios files. Not only this is bad (ie: this means puppet-openstack
users will have to also manually do it), but this also breaks the
scheduling, as default Apache files gets removed before the Apache wsgi
services are setup, then the keystone package installs the file,
meaning that at the 2nd run, the CI believes the run is not indempotent.

So, this patch adds libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 selection when running with
Debian packages, before we can remove this from fixtures/scenario00X.pp
files.

Change-Id: Ib9d0e34dbf18bb84313fd319f787fb8be873a695

commit_message:
WIP: do not select mod-wsgi-py3

Selecting mod-wsgi-py3 should be done when using the wsgi module, not
before, otherwise the keystone package adds wsgi-keystone.conf after
the module removes all files.

Depends-On: Ia40805f27e8833fa01576432ae792e1becedd729
Depends-On: Ib9d0e34dbf18bb84313fd319f787fb8be873a695
Change-Id: I753dd68c3a38b4eb505ed11f13c58420471ce6c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 06:27:07.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic5d768324d2430a06e8fd8d4c9c802ba34f36a36
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic5d768324d2430a06e8fd8d4c9c802ba34f36a36

commit_message:
Match only haproxy for docker ps and skipp all *-haproxy occurences

The grep regexp can match several lines if the haproxy pattern
is present.
By matching only the started by a whitespace it will match
the haproxy container listed by docker ps:
[...] Up 17 hours   neutron-haproxy-qrouter
[...] Up 20 hours   haproxy-bundle-docker-

Change-Id: Id63991e862ab10170c8afbde7a11677cc3d2e2f6

commit_message:
Remove global-requirements.txt copy

This file has now changed and does not include a minimum
version, since the requirements project split that and moved to
lower-constraints.txt. Thus, it does not make sense for us to keep it
anymore.

On the flip side, we are not using these requirements anymore to
render the required versions of dependencies, so we could be behind
the minimum. We will need to develop tooling for that.

Change-Id: Ib0d74cb3742bdde49104ff07250000fa0606899c

commit_message:
configure python publishing jobs separately for different branches

After projects move to the python3 publishing job we probably still
want them to use the python2 version on their stable branches.

Change-Id: I130af658afbc64107a9c631afcd26efcc7bdffe3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
PVC monitoring: Add alerting rules and service check for PVCs

This adds a basic check for capacity utilization for persistent
volume claims. To accomplish this, it adds a basic alerting rule
to prometheus that triggers after a persistent volume's usage
exceeds 80%, and triggers 5 minutes after that state has been
reached.  In addition, there is a service check added to the
nagios chart that will query Prometheus to check if the alarm
for that threshhold is firing for any of the volume claims.

Change-Id: I862c860ac479a715733202f679bb151885d7aa7c

commit_message:
Remove Fedora workaround for unit tests

As discussed in [1], we are removing the Fedora workaround for unit
tests in oslo.concurrency and oslo.rootwrap, and replacing it by
explicitly setting the PYTHON environment variable in the unit
test execution.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/570232

Change-Id: Iffc3d799027065fb5e14386b31045250fdbad043
Depends-On: I1c92888cf830b2ab5fdc154a0322e6e54d5712f7

commit_message:
remove model_query_scope from common db mixin

The model_query_scope method is not used from common db mixin [1]. This
patch removes it on the path to eventually removing common db mixin
all together.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.model_query_scope%5C(

Change-Id: Ib8ce6e9f6000e9c01d28c1471b885b0f3c8a041b

[{'created': '2018-06-07 10:54:45.000000000', 'message': "Allow domain remap storage_domain to be configured for func tests

Previously some tests in /test/functional/test_staticweb.py assumed
that domain_remap middleware was configured with the default
storage_domain 'example.com'. As a result those tests would fail if
run against a cluster with domain_remap middleware installed but not
having an 'example.com' storage_domain.

This patch allows a storage_domain to be configured in the test.conf
file so that the tests may be successfully run against any cluster. If
the option is not set then the tests will be skipped.

To ensure that the in process test job func-domain-remap-staticweb
still runs all the tests in test_staticweb.py, its config loader is
modified to add the required storage_domain option to the test config
with the same value used by the domain_remap middleware.

Related-Change: I6bc70039c1b99b8a5bf5a30e9c6877d4f0aa638d
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow domain remap storage_domain to be configured for func tests

Previously some tests in /test/functional/test_staticweb.py assumed
that domain_remap middleware was configured with the default
storage_domain 'example.com'. As a result those tests would fail if
run against a cluster with domain_remap middleware installed but not
having an 'example.com' storage_domain.

This patch allows a storage_domain to be configured in the test.conf
file so that the tests may be successfully run against any cluster. If
the option is not set then the tests will be skipped.

To ensure that the in process test job func-domain-remap-staticweb
still runs all the tests in test_staticweb.py, its config loader is
modified to add the required storage_domain option to the test config
with the same value used by the domain_remap middleware.

Related-Change: I6bc70039c1b99b8a5bf5a30e9c6877d4f0aa638d
Co-Authored-By: Tim Burke <tim.burke@gmail.com>

Change-Id: Ifab84fc3ef66b9790e96ebb8e5c8061a12636045

commit_message:
Fix stable pike build errors

This is a squash of two commits that need to be merged together in order
to get all tests to pass:

Commit message #1:

Use Zuul v3 fetch-subunit-output

We have consolidated the fetch output roles into one
fetch-subunit-output, replace useage of old roles with new one.

Original change-id: Iae2892d9b4cd870a11579434edc9ee66bd16798c
(cherry picked from commit 0a2ee90204068a1284f207397bcb253ec1e13c7e)

Commit message #2:

Fix sphinx-docs job for stable branch

build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fail on stable branches because the
new pip version 10 changed a Warning into an Error: When calling
"pip install" without any package name, the command now fails.
tox_install.sh is being called during docs job without any package
passed to pip.

Note that this only affects stable/pike and older, so there is no patch
in master to cherry-pick this from. Newer branches use a different way
to set up the tox environment.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/573665
Change-Id: I35e9ede7103031ea3ea45e35d743e63059fb8d0b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-12 22:14:56.000000000', 'message': '[OVS] Fix for cleaning after skipped_devices

When Openvswitch agent will get "port_update" event
(e.g. to set port as unbound) and port is already removed
from br-int when agent tries to get vif port in
treat_devices_added_updated() method (port is removed
because e.g. nova-compute removes it) then resources set
for port by L2 agent extension drivers (like qos) are not
cleaned properly.

In such case port is added to skipped_ports and is set
as DOWN in neutron-db but ext_manager is not called then
for such port so it will not clear stuff like bandwidth
limit's QoS and queue records and also DSCP marking
open flow rules for this port.

This patch fixes this issue by adding call of
ext_manager.delete_port() method for all skipped ports.

Change-Id: I3cf5c57c7f232deaa190ab6b0129e398fdabe592
Closes-Bug: #1737892
'}]
commit_message:
[OVS] Fix for cleaning after skipped_devices

When Openvswitch agent will get "port_update" event
(e.g. to set port as unbound) and port is already removed
from br-int when agent tries to get vif port in
treat_devices_added_updated() method (port is removed
because e.g. nova-compute removes it) then resources set
for port by L2 agent extension drivers (like qos) are not
cleaned properly.

In such case port is added to skipped_ports and is set
as DOWN in neutron-db but ext_manager is not called then
for such port so it will not clear stuff like bandwidth
limit's QoS and queue records and also DSCP marking
open flow rules for this port.

This patch fixes this issue by adding call of
ext_manager.delete_port() method for all skipped ports.

Change-Id: I3cf5c57c7f232deaa190ab6b0129e398fdabe592
Closes-Bug: #1737892

commit_message:
use make_weak_ref and resolve_ref from neutron-lib

The make_weak_ref and resolve_ref functions were rehomed into
neutron-lib with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557809/
This patch consumes them by removing the functions and using lib's
version of them instead.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: I41169ed0d93ea8caee530dcfc01a91271f02d538

There can be other software deployment tests running parallelly and
listing may contain config/deployment from those tests. We should check
for specific config/deployment instead.

Change-Id: Ia44f3999c6c99e44da4f15ef157804c63246cb34
Story: #2002529
Task: #22070
'}]
commit_message:
Fix software config/deployment api tests

There can be other software deployment tests running parallelly and
listing may contain config/deployment from those tests. We should check
for specific config/deployment instead.

Change-Id: Ia44f3999c6c99e44da4f15ef157804c63246cb34
Story: #2002529
Task: #22070

commit_message:
Remove the --container-registry-file parameter from upgrade clis

See topic branch at [0] for related reviews. The container registry file
parameter is being removed and replaced by regular -e to include the
container images as an environment file

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:remove-container-registry-file

Change-Id: Ief17a16aad82f0690cdde24b028312f24b3285b7
(cherry picked from commit a66ee2c7c2e61773c1546f50b6dcbe319796f6e5)

commit_message:
Fix logs by setting defaults for tempest_format

Bug was introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566527/
Set default value for tempest_format in logs collection role
when it publishes docs.
Closes-Bug: #1776164

Change-Id: I25a73bbd3804cf013f38627ca3d742e3a6a2f5d1

commit_message:
UpdatePlanEnvironmentAction enable overwrite or merge

Currently it's only possible to merge which doesn't work well
for non dict keys, and probably isn't what we want when updating
e.g the list of environments from the CLI.

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I0f32ca1029430579312b9130eccebe2bf7d1db56

subject: raise_exc default in Adapter
messages: [{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-06-12 15:52:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-06-12 15:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nnice, fast too'}, {'account_id': 2903, 'date': '2018-06-12 15:55:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-06-12 15:56:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 15:52:25.000000000', 'message': 'raise_exc default in Adapter

It can be annoying to have to say raise_exc=False (or use try/except) on
every call when talking to an API where 4xx response codes are
useful/normal/informative or where the preferred coding style is to use
conditionals rather than try/except.

With this change, the Adapter constructor takes a new kwarg, raise_exc.
It defaults to None, and the existing behavior is unchanged.  If set to
a boolean value, that is used as the default for requests.  Specifying
raise_exc to the primitives (get, head, put, post, patch, delete,
request) at any point along the chain will still take precedence.

Change-Id: Ie291c3cb891467728d8ca33cf62afdab37c82f34
Closes-Bug: #1776501
'}]
commit_message:
raise_exc default in Adapter

It can be annoying to have to say raise_exc=False (or use try/except) on
every call when talking to an API where 4xx response codes are
useful/normal/informative or where the preferred coding style is to use
conditionals rather than try/except.

With this change, the Adapter constructor takes a new kwarg, raise_exc.
It defaults to None, and the existing behavior is unchanged.  If set to
a boolean value, that is used as the default for requests.  Specifying
raise_exc to the primitives (get, head, put, post, patch, delete,
request) at any point along the chain will still take precedence.

Change-Id: Ie291c3cb891467728d8ca33cf62afdab37c82f34
Closes-Bug: #1776501

[{'created': '2017-10-24 19:36:20.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp: Define 'preferred' to False instead of none

Define preferred to false instead of none in the NetApp driver
as setting it to none will trigger a traceback later on because
the database doesn't allow null values to be inserted.
"preferred" export location metadata must be set to true or
false.  warning logging is also added to the SQLAlchemy API
if a none value is used to update the export location metadata.

Change-Id: Ie7420c9286cc42eaa1361eeffe607b9b5b6b3fbd
Closes-Bug: 1703660
(cherry picked from commit 4573826d361b44c367ca54c5d0f7943346666ade)

(cherry picked from commit 6dd4039a304061df122153c6f6f3a00a5e33db64)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Define 'preferred' to False instead of none

Define preferred to false instead of none in the NetApp driver
as setting it to none will trigger a traceback later on because
the database doesn't allow null values to be inserted.
"preferred" export location metadata must be set to true or
false.  warning logging is also added to the SQLAlchemy API
if a none value is used to update the export location metadata.

Change-Id: Ie7420c9286cc42eaa1361eeffe607b9b5b6b3fbd
Closes-Bug: 1703660
(cherry picked from commit 4573826d361b44c367ca54c5d0f7943346666ade)
(cherry picked from commit 0a5d760ed5e49b0aef34ce909d4570585e1b4681)
(cherry picked from commit 6dd4039a304061df122153c6f6f3a00a5e33db64)

commit_message:
Add new roles to OpenStack-Ansible

Two new roles have been asked by the community: a way to
deploy zun, and a way to use qpid dispatch router instead of
rabbitmq.

This patch includes both new roles, as we usually do:
They will be separate of the openstack-ansible main deliverable,
like other roles before it.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/572551/
Change-Id: I5fb2f24d2eecd38de793a1e739e14614b488e01d

This is a small python library and utility to monitor the partitions,

commit_message:
Add afsmon project under infra

This is a small python library and utility to monitor the partitions,
volumes and other statistics of AFS servers and report them for
collection.  Although there are other AFS monitoring utilities, no
extant projects were found that abstract the data into Python or
support statsd reporting.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/572371
Change-Id: I626fd809502f5df77574c7d70aa7e029a11ecf6b

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-19559 : SUCCESS in 52m 44s'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-06-07 16:49:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

I'm really not sure what to do with this patch. :(

I don't see any test assertions changed for existing tests, which means this isn't actually fixing any bug with the existing returned allocation candidates.

And instead of keeping the sharing provider code paths separate from the non-sharing provider code paths (which was done very specifically to keep that complexity away from the happy path of placement queries), this patch is continuing down the road that the merge allocation candidates and granular request group series has laid in essentially combining all the purpose-built query functions into one big function that processes the requests together.

There's no way any more for me to point to the codebase and explain to any reader of the code "this is how the placement queries work for the simple case of requesting X VCPUs, Y amount of MEMORY and some local disk. Instead, everything now must pass through merge_candidates(), anchor_providers() all the complex code paths and it's virtually impossible any more to figure out what's going on in the codebase for the simple happy path.

I just don't know any more.

-jay'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-06-07 17:50:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

OK, I've vented enough on this. I'm not happy with the direction that the server side is going, but I definitely feel pressured to move forward with this series.

I can tack on some refactoring to other patch series to address the gripes I have.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-06-07 20:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/567508/18/ : SUCCESS in 4h 32m 31s'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-06-08 01:51:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

(2 comments)

> I don't see any test assertions changed for existing tests, which means this isn't actually fixing any bug with the existing returned allocation candidates.

Well, this patch fixes bug #1732731 reported in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/519601/. Ive updated that patch. Sorry for being unclear.

> And instead of keeping the sharing provider code paths separate from the non-sharing provider code paths 

I at first tried to keep the sharing provider code paths  in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/556450/1, but we agreed thats not efficient.
We could preserve two different ways (sharing supported path and no sharing path) to support nested providers, but the two path would be both big and complex as well,
which forces us to create a lot of tests for each path. but thats not what we want, is it? 

Or if you are suggesting creating a short path where nested providers and sharing providers do not exist in the environment, shall I suppose that in a following patch?"}]

commit_message:
Support nested alloc cands with sharing providers

This patch enables nested allocation candidates in cases where
sharing providers are also in the environment.

The logic is mainly added to the existing function
_alloc_candidates_nested_no_shared() renaming it to
_alloc_candidates_multiple_provider().

Because this new function is also available when there is neither
sharing providers nor nested providers, this patch merges the
existing _alloc_candidates_with_shared() and _get_all_with_shared()
function to _alloc_candidates_multiple_provider().

Change-Id: Ib1738fb4a4664aa7b78398655fd23159a54f5f69
Blueprint: nested-resource-providers-allocation-candidates
