commit_message:
Resolve issues with long interface names

Resync charm helpers to pickup fixes to support veth wiring of
OVS bridges directly to Linux bridges created with MAAS.

Linux has a maximum interface name length of 15 charms; the
change ensures that the generated interface length for the veth
pair fits within this limitation.

Previous behaviour (that worked) is preserved to avoid duplicate
veth wiring or direct wiring of the Linux bridge to OVS.

Change-Id: Icef4efc179e8f812dd08f2423ed832a48573aa75
Closes-Bug: 1773353

messages: [{'account_id': 17499, 'date': '2018-06-12 02:45:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2018-06-12 08:02:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-06-12 08:58:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 02:45:33.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4ac80e1d6ff061df65694c8f35518b0b69bf5dd8
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4ac80e1d6ff061df65694c8f35518b0b69bf5dd8

commit_message:
Allow configuration of NFS backend for Nova

Allow NFS configuration of storage backend for Nova.
This way the instances files will be stored on a shared
NFS storage.

Implements: bp tripleo-nova-nfs

Depends-On: Id15aec6324814a871e87f19f24999b0e3b8a8f05

Change-Id: Ie4fe217bd119b638f42c682d21572547f02f17b2

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 06:27:08.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7554206c062b27194a130983c5447abce10daf7f
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7554206c062b27194a130983c5447abce10daf7f

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3557d033a75ed4cd38903be05dbb970f42fbaa20

By default the LBaaS v2 shouldn't be enabled on an aio.
Instead, the scenario for octavia should be used, as lbaas v2
is not the latest way of doing.

Change-Id: I46a77ea2f8ab6ad8198a031572e77f7bfbd1d056
"}]
commit_message:
Disable LBaaS v2 on the aio

By default the LBaaS v2 shouldn't be enabled on an aio.
Instead, the scenario for octavia should be used, as lbaas v2
is not the latest way of doing.

Change-Id: I46a77ea2f8ab6ad8198a031572e77f7bfbd1d056

commit_message:
dashboard: Fix test failures caused by django test runner

Recently horizon test configuration was changed to use
the Django default test runner because nose is in maintenance mode
for the past several years [1]. Django testcase and testtools are
incompatible, so bgpvpn_dashboard testcases now fail.

In addition, bgpvpn_dashboard/test/test.py is unnecessary
and it causes the test failure too, so this file will be
dropped by this commit.

[1] horizon commit 1f80d94459856a8c477310cc0fe4b0e165d8c0c1

Change-Id: I45ff876871d7dcb82f284061b3a7225dd65c771b
Closes-Bug: #1776223

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Idba5b407405e7d1457a02b074bf60b7fded284ee
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use OS_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD instead of passing CLI

When bootstrapping use environment variable
OS_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD instead of passing password
over CLI since it's a possible leak.

Change-Id: I69783f75600048b9c4b2abb445b59e135029f3df
Partial-Bug: 1557790
(cherry picked from commit b933d0bd1a69628f263d59894dd5f217415d45da)

commit_message:
use object utils from neutron-lib

The neutron.object.utils module was rehomed into neutron-lib with
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557809/
This patch consumes it by removing the neutron.objects.utils module
and corresponding test module, updating the contributor internals for
objects and using lib's version of the module.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: If53d0ad660851275462d2641ed1829cdb4c32d05

commit_message:
scripts: bootstrap-ansible: Install python-pip on SUSE and Ubuntu

SUSE and Ubuntu provide a relatively new python-pip package. Having it
installed can save us a bit of time since the pip_install role will not
have to do much on these distributions.

Change-Id: If51c3fb37b934a91ab44a522c6f9772f2dd91d31

commit_message:
Remove minimum version check when save service

If we have a deleted service in nova db for Ocata, after we upgrade it
to Pike, this service won't have an uuid. It will raise an exception
"This service is older (v16) than the minimum (v30) version" when add
uuid for this service. So we need to remove the version check for
service save function.

Change-Id: I7ace9e9215992e3aec56ea9a22cd170ab95f6e4a
Closes-Bug: #1764556

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 17:47:45.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I70b4fb58c7800158907d80f83018e39d1b785668
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I70b4fb58c7800158907d80f83018e39d1b785668

commit_message:
doc: Describe running a command as a separate group

Some commands must be run as a separate group to work. Users can use the
'sg' tool to do this.

This may be assumed knowledge for many users but it's helpful to note in
this, the definitive resource for DevStack's systemd integration.

Change-Id: I271c1d21b44fa972c152780c1caa01c21c265159
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iee784dd6b5c5e2568dbcbeedef12a00510a9cef1
'}, {'created': '2018-06-12 08:05:37.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Remove dependency on EPEL"

This reverts commit ef9c4f1ea590cb020b3ca2f4739c4eb7b2f3a684.

The EPEL repository is still needed to fetch packages such as aria2
otherwise it fails with the following problem:

"No package matching 'aria2' found available, installed or updated"

Moreover, the 'epel-release' package does not exist in the default
CentOS repositories so we can't simply install it on the roles which
need it. It seems to be installed using the regular yum_repository
approach as we see below.

[vagrant@localhost ~]$ sudo yum search epel-release
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
 * base: centos.serverspace.co.uk
 * updates: mirror.freethought-internet.co.uk
Warning: No matches found for: epel-release
No matches found

Change-Id: Iee784dd6b5c5e2568dbcbeedef12a00510a9cef1
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Remove dependency on EPEL"

This reverts commit ef9c4f1ea590cb020b3ca2f4739c4eb7b2f3a684.

The EPEL repository is still needed to fetch packages such as aria2
otherwise it fails with the following problem:

"No package matching 'aria2' found available, installed or updated"

Moreover, the 'epel-release' package does not exist in the default
CentOS repositories so we can't simply install it on the roles which
need it. It seems to be installed using the regular yum_repository
approach as we see below.

[vagrant@localhost ~]$ sudo yum search epel-release
Loaded plugins: fastestmirror
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
 * base: centos.serverspace.co.uk
 * updates: mirror.freethought-internet.co.uk
Warning: No matches found for: epel-release
No matches found

Change-Id: Iee784dd6b5c5e2568dbcbeedef12a00510a9cef1

[{'created': '2018-06-12 07:50:06.000000000', 'message': "tests: Add dependency to the 'openstack_hosts' role

The openstack_hosts role prepares the host for an OpenStack deployment
and as such we should run it before we test this role in order to ensure
that the host is properly configured. Moreover, the openstack_hosts also
prepares the repositories on the host which needs to happen before we
execute this role in order to have all the repositories present.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574589/
Change-Id: I581daacb83405335f782f8262c165dfebe4876c1
"}]
commit_message:
tests: Add dependency to the 'openstack_hosts' role

The openstack_hosts role prepares the host for an OpenStack deployment
and as such we should run it before we test this role in order to ensure
that the host is properly configured. Moreover, the openstack_hosts also
prepares the repositories on the host which needs to happen before we
execute this role in order to have all the repositories present.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/574589/

[{'created': '2018-06-01 07:47:43.000000000', 'message': "Add ACL commands that don't depend on Logical Switches

After introducing the concept of Port Groups in OVN, ACL's will
be no longer linked applied to a Logical Switch. Current implementation
of the ACL commands is tightly coupled to Logical Switches.
Until we finally decide to drop the current implementation, this
patch is adding new commands to deal with ACLs solely in the ACL
table.

commit_message:
Add Port Group ACL commands

After introducing the concept of Port Groups in OVN, ACLs can be
applied either to a Logical Switch or to a Port Group.
This patch is adding the commands to support adding ACLs to a Port
Group. Also it's removing the initial implementation of adding
standalone ACLs to a Port Group.

Change-Id: I7720cd7aa801fbc4be87e1c665e4549725576269
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 20:07:36.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9e1dfd8d4ff6039cbf6d26d1c55fe8c6f7fb84e1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I9e1dfd8d4ff6039cbf6d26d1c55fe8c6f7fb84e1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Implements a standard pattern to normalize user provided templates by
copying them into the working tht path.  When a user provides a -e for a
file that already exists within the templates path, it is updated to the
expected working tht root.  For files that are outside of the templates
path, they will be copied into the root of the working tht root and
processed using the process-templates.py during the deployment. This
allows for a standard relative path and supports j2 files.

Note that this means you will not be able to provide two identically
named files that live outside of the templates folder since they will
conflict. An explicit exception is thrown if the system identifies an
already existing file.

commit_message:
Copy user provided files into working tht root

Implements a standard pattern to normalize user provided templates by
copying them into the working tht path.  When a user provides a -e for a
file that already exists within the templates path, it is updated to the
expected working tht root.  For files that are outside of the templates
path, they will be copied into the root of the working tht root and
processed using the process-templates.py during the deployment. This
allows for a standard relative path and supports j2 files.

Note that this means you will not be able to provide two identically
named files that live outside of the templates folder since they will
conflict. An explicit exception is thrown if the system identifies an
already existing file.

Change-Id: I2138a5dcf6a2aff04f7e522cbdf2d5ce94283dc1
Related-Blueprint: all-in-one

commit_message:
Address follow-on comments in strict-two-level spec

This change addresses concerns raised in the original review of the
strict two level enforcement model:

  Ibfb2ba2ffb0115fa7cf81d30bf9a025652d9ba42

bp strict-two-level-enforcement-model

Change-Id: I7190443de8be189eac06a6f01f99a5e5bfabbbc9

commit_message:
Ability to enable VLAN trunking

This fix add ability to enable VLAN trunking in configuration.

Signed-off-by: Anton Kremenetsky <akremenetsky@dev.rtsoft.ru>

Change-Id: If80dc4750e6639bdc41bc62eede350019b4306c5
Closes-Bug: #1772979

[{'created': '2018-06-06 08:57:00.000000000', 'message': 'Added share server in ensure shares method

The share server cannot be set through ensure shares
method, now we will add share server as part of share
instance parameter in ensure shares method.

Closes-Bug: #1771866
'}]
commit_message:
Added share server in ensure shares method

The share server cannot be set through ensure shares
method, now we will add share server as part of share
instance parameter in ensure shares method.

Change-Id: I8d704c747ef2f13b7085d1f212d56811d1a17fb1
Closes-Bug: #1771866

commit_message:
Use uwsgi for devstack

According to:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/pike/deploy-api-in-wsgi.html
However, this patch:
https://review.openstack.org/460951/
changed the goal to use uwsgi by default.

Change-Id: Id02deddc52d81b9cd240364a22422a31fc02c9c3

(3 comments)

Nit on the config option message, but since it's user facing we should probably fix that."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-06-05 18:46:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-06-05 23:30:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-07 14:55:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Some comments missed from patch rev 1 that I think would be good to fix.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-06-08 08:33:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Some initial findings, Still I need to find workaround to OSError mentioned in comments to test further.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-06-08 10:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-06-08 10:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-06-08 10:45:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-06-08 11:08:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Will continue testing at night'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-06-08 11:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 27882, 'date': '2018-06-08 14:42:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-06-08 18:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

(3 comments)

Looks good to me.
Tested below scenarios:
1. Conversion from qcow2 to raw
2. Conversion from raw to qcow2
3. Conversion from raw to raw and qcow2 to qcow2 (conversion does not happens as both format are same)
4. Booted instance from both converted images mentioned in 1 and 2

To test it with devstack please follow steps mentioned in https://bugs.launchpad.net/glance/+bug/1775782/comments/2

Some nits inside, once release note and documentaiton changes are done will give +2

Thank you Erno, great work!!!'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-06-11 11:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2018-06-06 23:24:56.000000000', 'message': "Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Change-Id: Ib1610eb9bcd493732e90a309d219690c43702400
Partial-Bug: #1712399
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Change-Id: Ib1610eb9bcd493732e90a309d219690c43702400
Partial-Bug: #1712399

commit_message:
Delete duplicate functions in placement test

In tests getting allocation candidates, this patch deletes
duplicate function of _get_rp_ids_matching_names() and use
_get_rp_ids_matching_names() instead.

Change-Id: I5b74cf1af3d03d346d40c6cf0f19b8d51439d878

Fix sudoers for Ceph

Since moving ansible to a virtualenv in the toolbox Ceph could not run
find_disks.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 18:46:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix server show for microversion 2.47

Compute API version 2.47 embeds the server's internal
flavor in the response. The original flavor id is not
preserved since it could have changed if the flavor
was deleted and re-created after the server was created,
which was the dreaded Horizon "Edit Flavor" issue.
So the flavor dict in the server response is a dict of
information about the flavor representing the server
"right now" excluding the id. The original flavor name
is shown though along with the ram/disk/vcpu etc
information.

Change-Id: I1a92999758006d02567c542b6be8902a049899cc
Task: 13864
Story: 1751104
'}, {'created': '2018-06-08 19:52:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix server show for microversion 2.47

Compute API version 2.47 embeds the server's internal
flavor in the response. The original flavor id is not
preserved since it could have changed if the flavor
was deleted and re-created after the server was created,
which was the dreaded Horizon "Edit Flavor" issue.
So the flavor dict in the server response is a dict of
information about the flavor representing the server
"right now" excluding the id. The original flavor name
is shown though along with the ram/disk/vcpu etc
information.

The server list command has a similar issue which
will be fixed in a follow up change.

Change-Id: I1a92999758006d02567c542b6be8902a049899cc
Task: 13864
Story: 1751104
'}]
commit_message:
Fix server show for microversion 2.47

Compute API version 2.47 embeds the server's internal
flavor in the response. The original flavor id is not
preserved since it could have changed if the flavor
was deleted and re-created after the server was created,
which was the dreaded Horizon "Edit Flavor" issue.
So the flavor dict in the server response is a dict of
information about the flavor representing the server
"right now" excluding the id. The original flavor name
is shown though along with the ram/disk/vcpu etc
information.

The server list command has a similar issue which
will be fixed in a follow up change.

Change-Id: I1a92999758006d02567c542b6be8902a049899cc
Task: 13864
Story: 1751104

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-21 06:39:42.000000000', 'message': 'Use list instead of set for duplicate check

There can be legitimately distinct allocation requests with the same
combination of providers. For example, in a case where where both
SHR1 and SHR2 have both CUSTOM_RC1 and CUSTOM_RC2, the following two
allocation requests are different:

 AllocationRequest(anchor=CN, resource_requests=[
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=CN, resources=[VCPU: 1]),
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=SHR1, resources=[CUSTOM_RC1: 1]),
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=SHR2, resources=[CUSTOM_RC2: 1]),
 ])

 AllocationRequest(anchor=CN, resource_requests=[
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=CN, resources=[VCPU: 1]),
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=SHR2, resources=[CUSTOM_RC1: 1]),
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=SHR1, resources=[CUSTOM_RC2: 1]),
 ])

But getting allocation candidates, placement had been filtering out
one of the two assuming them as the same allocation requests because
the combination of the providers in play was the same.

This was because placement filtered duplicate candidates using a set
of provider ids in play while we can't consider resource information
with the set. This patch fixes the bug by using the list instead of
the set. This is because we can put resource information in the order
of that list. Namely, in the example above, we can't detect
"set([CN, SHR1, SHR2])" is differebt as "set([CN, SHR2, SHR1])", but
we can detect [CN, SHR1, SHR2] is different from [CN, SHR2, SHR1].

Change-Id: I90627dfe85661118c4ec2571fc32ffca99dd73d2
Blueprint: nested-resource-providers-allocation-candidates
Closes-Bug: #1772243

commit_message:
Use list instead of set for duplicate check

There can be legitimately distinct allocation requests with the same
combination of providers. For example, in a case where where both
SHR1 and SHR2 have both CUSTOM_RC1 and CUSTOM_RC2, the following two
allocation requests are different:

 AllocationRequest(anchor=CN, resource_requests=[
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=CN, resources=[VCPU: 1]),
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=SHR1, resources=[CUSTOM_RC1: 1]),
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=SHR2, resources=[CUSTOM_RC2: 1]),
 ])

 AllocationRequest(anchor=CN, resource_requests=[
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=CN, resources=[VCPU: 1]),
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=SHR2, resources=[CUSTOM_RC1: 1]),
     AllocationRequestResource(rp=SHR1, resources=[CUSTOM_RC2: 1]),
 ])

But getting allocation candidates, placement had been filtering out
one of the two assuming them as the same allocation requests because
the combination of the providers in play was the same.

This was because placement filtered duplicate candidates using a set
of provider ids in play while we can't consider resource information
with the set. This patch fixes the bug by using the list instead of
the set. This is because we can put resource information in the order
of that list. Namely, in the example above, we can't detect
"set([CN, SHR1, SHR2])" is different as "set([CN, SHR2, SHR1])", but
we can detect [CN, SHR1, SHR2] is different from [CN, SHR2, SHR1].

Change-Id: I90627dfe85661118c4ec2571fc32ffca99dd73d2
Blueprint: nested-resource-providers-allocation-candidates
Closes-Bug: #1772243

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 16:47:10.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I1ab75bc1ebaec7559f4078add7a164b152064f39
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I1ab75bc1ebaec7559f4078add7a164b152064f39
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-05-11 11:15:56.000000000', 'message': 'Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

The arguments of include() has been changed in Django 1.9
and the older style was dropped in Django 2.0.
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.9/#passing-a-3-tuple-or-an-app-name-to-include

Add py35dj20 job to test Django 2.0 integration.
Also drops older Django unit tests from tox.ini
as horizon dropped Django <=1.10 support in Rocky.

Change-Id: I122f8ad81807386517149f37aa8d63c76daac533

commit_message:
Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

The arguments of include() has been changed in Django 1.9
and the older style was dropped in Django 2.0.
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.9/#passing-a-3-tuple-or-an-app-name-to-include

Add py35dj20 job to test Django 2.0 integration.
Also drops older Django unit tests from tox.ini
as horizon dropped Django <=1.10 support in Rocky.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571061/
Change-Id: I122f8ad81807386517149f37aa8d63c76daac533

What happens today when an operator does not encrypt the passwords in the conf file?'}, {'account_id': 26422, 'date': '2018-05-30 02:27:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If you remove this support any operator depending on the password being encrypted who is already using the driver with encrypted passwords has to do what to continue using the drivers?
[Answer]:In this case, the operator need to change the password in cinder.conf and restart the cinder volume service. We will document it in this patch.

What happens today when an operator does not encrypt the passwords in the conf file?
[Answer]: If this patch doesn't implement in IBM driver, the cinder initilization will failed if the operator does not encrypt the password in cinder.conf"}, {'account_id': 26422, 'date': '2018-06-04 02:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26422, 'date': '2018-06-04 02:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2018-06-04 05:32:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

In current IBM DS8K and XIV/A9K Driver user guide doesn't point out that the "san_password" parameter in cinder.conf need to encrypt, but the dirver code only accepts the encrypted password, otherwise, the driver will fail in the initialization process. We think it will confuse the end user.
In this patch, DS8K and XIV/A9K dirver remove the encrypt function and a unencrypted password will be accepted.'}, {'account_id': 26422, 'date': '2018-06-05 07:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 26422, 'date': '2018-06-05 07:28:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2018-06-05 09:27:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
IBM: Remove the encrypt function for DS8k and XIV/A9000

Currently, our driver is open source but encrypt the password
in cinder.conf still exists in it. This is an open and transparent
process and it also brings the inconvenience for the end user.
IBM SVC doesn't have this function, so we will remove this function 
for the DS8K and XIV/A9000

Change-Id: I438f97741a5949581c12dcf72fd796fccaed0b6e
Closes-Bug: 1773745

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-12 00:47:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix jq quoting issue when waiting for nodes

The deploy-kubeadm-aio-node role uses a jq query to wait for all nodes to be
in Ready status before proceeding.  Although the query works fine in the gate,
it chokes in my environment (fresh Ubuntu 16.04) on the single quotes
surrounding KubeletReady.  I escape them here so that the query works in all
environments.

Change-Id: Id77c9d01b1b65516d08f19c7714966705199384a
Story: 2002526
Task: 22065
'}]
commit_message:
Fix jq quoting issue when waiting for nodes

The deploy-kubeadm-aio-node role uses a jq query to wait for all nodes to be
in Ready status before proceeding.  Although the query works fine in the gate,
it chokes in my environment (fresh Ubuntu 16.04) on the single quotes
surrounding KubeletReady.  I escape them here so that the query works in all
environments.

Change-Id: Id77c9d01b1b65516d08f19c7714966705199384a
Story: 2002526
Task: 22065

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 14:45:58.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7e588a3ea39d55e0e19650c927d068db861230e9
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7e588a3ea39d55e0e19650c927d068db861230e9

commit_message:
Add support for NSXV3

NSXV3 is the OpenStack support for the NSX Transformers platform.
This is supported from neutron in the Mitaka version. This patch
adds Kolla support

This adds a new neutron_plugin_agent type 'vmware_nsxv3'. The plugin
does not run any neutron agents.

Change-Id: I1ecd7e5f3471e4ff03cfe8c9a3aff17af3fe1842

subject: [VNX Cinder] Deprecate option storage_vnx_pool_name
messages:
[{'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2018-06-06 10:10:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-06-07 06:01:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Changes to parameters needs to be deprecated for atleast one cycle before being changed. Please see this guide [1].

Please provide support for both parameters during one cycle for transition, add a "deprecation" release note using reno [2], fix spec testing.

Let us know if anything is unclear and we can help out here or on #puppet-openstack on IRC.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/puppet-openstack-guide/latest/contributor/coding-style.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2018-06-08 03:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2018-06-08 05:46:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2018-06-08 05:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 > before being changed. Please see this guide [1].

 > [1] https://docs.openstack.org/puppet-openstack-guide/latest/contributor/coding-style.html
 > [2] https://docs.openstack.org/reno/latest/user/usage.html

Release note added. "fixes" section is added instead of "deprecation" since this is a bug fix for the option (typo: storage_vnx_pool_name should be storage_vnx_pool_names), is that correct?'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-06-08 07:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

Some comments inline, should we consider this completely broken i.e has the config option "storage_vnx_pool_name" *never* worked or existed? If so we can probably push this through without backporting, but if it has worked in the past we must support the usage of the old parameter "storage_vnx_pool_name" in the Puppet interface for atleast one cycle.'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-06-08 07:22:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

s/backporting/deprecating/g'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2018-06-08 08:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

 > backporting, but if it has worked in the past we must support the
 > usage of the old parameter "storage_vnx_pool_name" in the Puppet
 > interface for atleast one cycle.

I checked the Cinder code, storage_vnx_pool_name was deprecated very long time ago (from Liberty). I will follow the deprecation process to update the patch. commit_message:
[VNX Cinder] Deprecate option storage_vnx_pool_name

Deprecate option storage_vnx_pool_name, use storage_vnx_pool_names
instead

Change-Id: I415eee7ddc601d1706a5d7f2a561e11b642fa826
Closes-bug: #1775375

[{'created': '2018-05-31 21:28:37.000000000', 'message': 'Mention running rootwrap in daemon mode if hitting vif plug timeouts

Per an operators mailing list thread [1] people can hit vif
plug timeouts at scale and a possible solution is running
rootwrap in daemon mode in the neutron agent, which several
operators have said resolves the issue at scale for them.

This change adds a mention of that configuration in the
"vif_plugging_timeout" configuration option since that
might be the first place operators look when they start
hitting this issue.

A corresponding change will be made to neutron to improve
the config option help text for the "root_helper_daemon"
option.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-May/015364.html

Change-Id: I65c0d518bc1c1a0d94fa7ac01294b03cce7d3752
Closes-Bug: #1774217
'}]
commit_message:
Mention running rootwrap in daemon mode if hitting vif plug timeouts

Per an operators mailing list thread [1] people can hit vif
plug timeouts at scale and a possible solution is running
rootwrap in daemon mode in the neutron agent, which several
operators have said resolves the issue at scale for them.

This change adds a mention of that configuration in the
"vif_plugging_timeout" configuration option since that
might be the first place operators look when they start
hitting this issue.

A corresponding change will be made to neutron to improve
the config option help text for the "root_helper_daemon"
option.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-operators/2018-May/015364.html

Change-Id: I65c0d518bc1c1a0d94fa7ac01294b03cce7d3752
Closes-Bug: #1774217

commit_message:
Remove ironic_host_manager usage

The baremetal scheduling options were deprecated
in Pike and the ironic_host_manager was deprecated
in Queens and has now been removed. Deployments
must use resource classes now for baremetal scheduling.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/565805/
Change-Id: Ie57498f1953689c02fc6c796af0efffbb5c54f02

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 15:49:02.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize _prep_server_detail to avoid redundant find_resource

When showing a server or doing a rebuild, we already have
the latest version of the server so _prep_server_detail
getting the server again is an unnecessary performance hit.

ShowServer is pretty obvious here. For RebuildServer, the
compute API actually refreshes the server before returning
it in the response, so the client already gets the latest
when the rebuild call returns.

The only other usage of _prep_server_detail that does require
a refresh is CreateServer since the POST /servers response is
a minimal version of the server object.

This adds a new refresh kwarg, backward compatible by default,
to _prep_server_detail but changes ShowServer and RebuildServer
to no longer refresh.

Change-Id: Ib1c9c424ed1cafc2dfd8be90af8de8a774bdfbf0
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize _prep_server_detail to avoid redundant find_resource

When showing a server or doing a rebuild, we already have
the latest version of the server so _prep_server_detail
getting the server again is an unnecessary performance hit.

ShowServer is pretty obvious here. For RebuildServer, the
compute API actually refreshes the server before returning
it in the response, so the client already gets the latest
when the rebuild call returns.

The only other usage of _prep_server_detail that does require
a refresh is CreateServer since the POST /servers response is
a minimal version of the server object.

This adds a new refresh kwarg, backward compatible by default,
to _prep_server_detail but changes ShowServer and RebuildServer
to no longer refresh.

Change-Id: Ib1c9c424ed1cafc2dfd8be90af8de8a774bdfbf0

messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-06 19:27:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-06 19:32:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Wouldn't it be better to set basepython to python3 under [testenv] rather than each individual job.

Also, pretty sure some of these are going to fail."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-06 21:37:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Wouldn't it be better to set basepython to python3 under [testenv]
 > rather than each individual job.
 > 
 > Also, pretty sure some of these are going to fail.

Setting basepython under testenv messes with what we get for the py35 and py36 environments -- we get the default python 3 on the system, whatever that is, rather than the specific version the environment is supposed to be asking for.

Submitting the patches is meant to help us figure out where we're going to find failures. I've started fixing a bunch of the linter issues in other projects. We had fewer than I expected."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-06-06 21:42:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Wouldn't it be better to set basepython to python3 under
 > [testenv]
 > > rather than each individual job.
 > >
 > > Also, pretty sure some of these are going to fail.
 > 
 > Setting basepython under testenv messes with what we get for the
 > py35 and py36 environments -- we get the default python 3 on the
 > system, whatever that is, rather than the specific version the
 > environment is supposed to be asking for.

See http://paste.openstack.org/show/722836/ for example"}, {'account_id': 21976, 'date': '2018-06-06 22:47:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Build succeeded.

- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi http://54.209.116.144/14/572914/1/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi/f4107a7 : SUCCESS in 1h 38m 24s
- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC http://54.209.116.144/14/572914/1/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-FC/70ccbfc : SUCCESS in 1h 37m 20s'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-06-07 09:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-06-07 10:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-06-07 11:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I think it would be more concise and explicit for the different py3 versions to just add:

[testenv:py35]
basepython = python3.5

with the default basepython being python3, but meh.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-06 19:27:59.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie6a61e4db3f7d3f6e1c7478fab4ab4afb6c88ce1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie6a61e4db3f7d3f6e1c7478fab4ab4afb6c88ce1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add collect_timing param to authtoken

Ensure the `collect_timing` param is included within the
[keystone_authtoken] config section.

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I049d65727348ef73553f21adf18183383f28ca17
Closes-bug: 1775140

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 15:14:38.000000000', 'message': 'Use Server.to_dict() rather than Server._info

There is a to_dict() method on the Server object from
python-novaclient which makes a deepcopy of the internal
Server._info - use this instead of accessing the _info
attribute directly.

Also, while in here, fixed a typo in _prep_server_detail.

Change-Id: I679b4489c815f8a54368ef6b23b9f77e75b4d0bc
'}]
commit_message:
Use Server.to_dict() rather than Server._info

There is a to_dict() method on the Server object from
python-novaclient which makes a deepcopy of the internal
Server._info - use this instead of accessing the _info
attribute directly.

Also, while in here, fixed a typo in _prep_server_detail.

Change-Id: I679b4489c815f8a54368ef6b23b9f77e75b4d0bc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-08 06:27:08.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3b3aa0b249b3780b9906806d58a93aeedff865be
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I3b3aa0b249b3780b9906806d58a93aeedff865be

commit_message:
Honor service-type aliases in config

The correct config names are based on the official service type, such as
block_storage_api_version or OS_BLOCK_STORAGE_API_VERSION. But, there
are folks who have been using volume_api_version or
OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION.

Support looking for config values based on service-type aliases. The
official type will win.

Change-Id: I13c77ad4fce14a491b6a82f4c7e332d284d14e0d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-11 18:27:06.000000000', 'message': 'Resolve problems with Django 2.0

The Django method, reverse, used to convert the output
to bytes.  The 2.0 version no longer does this conversion.
The murano dashboard code was relying on this conversion.
Now the murano dashboard code will do the conversion before
calling the method, django http.HttpResponseRedirect since
it expects a byte array as input.

Change-Id: I8c8c0be4cdfd183b2bc92223eec476e2e8a33864
'}]
commit_message:
Resolve problems with Django 2.0

The Django method, reverse, used to convert the output
to bytes.  The 2.0 version no longer does this conversion.
The murano dashboard code was relying on this conversion.
Now the murano dashboard code will do the conversion before
calling the method, django http.HttpResponseRedirect since
it expects a byte array as input.

Change-Id: I8c8c0be4cdfd183b2bc92223eec476e2e8a33864

commit_message:
Make storage_domain configurable in func tests

There isn't actually a 'storage_domain' key in the 'swift' dict in /info
but we can pretend like there is. This allows test-runners to choose
their own domain, rather than requiring that their cluster support
'example.com' as a storage domain.

Note that we consciously *don't* want to expose the configured storage
domains in /info -- that would be at best a nuisance for operators, as
their users would see deprecated domains that should no longer be used,
and at worst a security hazard, exposing information about how internal
networks are laid out.

Change-Id: Ia8d365b95e6f5ab06b63a5a07470eed5d7dcfacb

commit_message:
Fix for kolla/etc copy in setup script

The cli_setup copy was creating an extra kolla directory on the copy-
/etc/kolla/kolla, instead of just /etc/kolla.

Also in utils, improved the error message when you don't have permissions
on getting a lock.

Change-Id: I7ee60c3203c4fe4a8222fd65cf8ef96414f15eb6

commit_message:
Fix Dockerfile for Debian Jessie

As we learned in I488445dfd261b7bca322a0be7b4d8ca6105750a3
that the the docker file needed to change, this is a targeted
change to address the docker file contents and not update
the coreos version that is built.

This is being done to fix the stable branch builds.

Change-Id: I7251dc7deac788716adad7b596f25fd1633cf289
(cherry picked from commit 3cb22eef0b86baed98c9f00d35a328d0212d14a1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 14:54:31.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie09277286885f22f7021d401c55830be32d7624a
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ie09277286885f22f7021d401c55830be32d7624a

commit_message:
remove keystone_token_provider configure item

keystone_token_provider only support fernet after [3] merged.
And Keystone also only support fernet by default[1][2].
Since fernet is only vaild value, we do not need let user to
configure this item.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/token-provider.html#
[2] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/tree/master/keystone/token/providers
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566210/

Change-Id: I208b259974e712d694f8f29488164c79b0029bb1

commit_message:
IBM XIV: Report backend state in service list

This patch implements reporting backend state in service list.

Change-Id: Ife48a8c9b362099e89865fcf0b3beb333704a87c
Implements: blueprint report-backend-state-in-service-list

commit_message:
Mark Disco driver unsupported

The Disco driver has not run 3rd Party CI
in more than 60 days.  This patch marks it
unsupported and it will be removed in Stein
if the 3rd Party CI Issues are not resolved.

Change-Id: I6098554cdc13760b4a31b19a4d2089d22a68d0e5

commit_message:
Move disk space check to run when needed

At the moment, the check for disk space when booting from an image
currently happens regardless if the backend supports cloning or not.

This means that even if a backend can clone the image directly, the
control plane must have enough disk to download the entire image
which can be unreasonable in backend such as RBD.

This patch moves the code which checks for enough disk space to be
in the same function that effectively downloads the image, ensuring
that it only runs when an image has to be downloaded and avoiding
the check if the backend successfully cloned the image.

Closes-Bug: #1744383
Change-Id: Ibfd6f40e8b8ab88d4ec76e9ac27617a0f97b6c29
(cherry picked from commit f62f8abad17d1c287d48ea273ea4c4fe7f536d07)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-01 11:46:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for volume from image snapshot free space issue

create_from_image() function checks for free space in conversion path
(by default /var/lib/cinder/conversion) even if cinder is creating
volume from image snapshot.

If /var/lib/cinder/conversion has less free space than the size of the
image volume is created from, exception will be thrown by
check_available_space() function in image_utils module.

This patch checks if cinder is configured with
allowed_direct_url_schemes = cinder
If so, cinder should not check free space in conversion path because
volume is created from image snapshot.

This is a manual cherry-pick from commit 30bb0dfbe.

Closes-Bug: #1683228
Change-Id: I6330ed31dc9336c9d3d09c2d43c8f4913744e9a2
'}, {'created': '2018-06-07 14:45:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for volume from image snapshot free space issue

create_from_image() function checks for free space in conversion path
(by default /var/lib/cinder/conversion) even if cinder is creating
volume from image snapshot.

If /var/lib/cinder/conversion has less free space than the size of the
image volume is created from, exception will be thrown by
check_available_space() function in image_utils module.

This patch checks if cinder is configured with
allowed_direct_url_schemes = cinder
If so, cinder should not check free space in conversion path because
volume is created from image snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1683228
Change-Id: I6330ed31dc9336c9d3d09c2d43c8f4913744e9a2
(cherry picked from commit 30bb0dfbe77efcfcb2330f1758d229310e52ff74)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for volume from image snapshot free space issue

create_from_image() function checks for free space in conversion path
(by default /var/lib/cinder/conversion) even if cinder is creating
volume from image snapshot.

If /var/lib/cinder/conversion has less free space than the size of the
image volume is created from, exception will be thrown by
check_available_space() function in image_utils module.

This patch checks if cinder is configured with
allowed_direct_url_schemes = cinder
If so, cinder should not check free space in conversion path because
volume is created from image snapshot.

Closes-Bug: #1683228
Change-Id: I6330ed31dc9336c9d3d09c2d43c8f4913744e9a2
(cherry picked from commit 30bb0dfbe77efcfcb2330f1758d229310e52ff74)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-25 19:37:17.000000000', 'message': "Fix VNC console in Debian

In Debian, SPICE is the default. Unfortunately, puppet-openstack fails to
set [spice]/enabled = false when VNC is selected, and therefore, both VNC
and SPICE ends up being enabled in nova.conf.

Also, Debian has a unique package nova-consoleproxy handling SPICE, VNC
and the XenVNC console, with /etc/default/nova-consoleproxy being used to
select what daemon to start. As puppet-openstack doesn't set it before
starting the VNC console service, it stays with spicehtml5 as default
value, and therefore, nova-novncproxy cannot start.

This patch fixes both issues.

Change-Id: Ia40805f27e8833fa01576432ae792e1becedd729

Also, Debian has a unique package nova-consoleproxy handling SPICE, VNC
and the XenVNC console, with /etc/default/nova-consoleproxy being used to
select what daemon to start. As puppet-openstack doesn't set it before
starting the VNC console service, it stays with spicehtml5 as default
value, and therefore, nova-novncproxy cannot start.

This patch fixes both issues.

Change-Id: Ia40805f27e8833fa01576432ae792e1becedd729

and SPICE ends up being enabled in nova.conf.

Also, Debian has a unique package nova-consoleproxy handling SPICE, VNC
and the XenVNC console, with /etc/default/nova-consoleproxy being used to
select what daemon to start. As puppet-openstack doesn't set it before
starting the VNC console service, it stays with spicehtml5 as default
value, and therefore, nova-novncproxy cannot start.

This patch fixes both issues.

Change-Id: Ia40805f27e8833fa01576432ae792e1becedd729

commit_message:
Fix VNC console in Debian

In Debian, SPICE is the default. Unfortunately, puppet-openstack fails to
set [spice]/enabled = false when VNC is selected, and therefore, both VNC
and SPICE ends up being enabled in nova.conf.

Also, Debian has a unique package nova-consoleproxy handling SPICE, VNC
and the XenVNC console, with /etc/default/nova-consoleproxy being used to
select what daemon to start. As puppet-openstack doesn't set it before
starting the VNC console service, it stays with spicehtml5 as default
value, and therefore, nova-novncproxy cannot start.

This patch fixes both issues.

Change-Id: Ia40805f27e8833fa01576432ae792e1becedd729

Move the version / discovery subsystem into the flask native app.

!! WIP !! this is very early on and wont pass tests/pep8 and is not
ready for review

commit_message:
Fix typo with Manila upgrade template

There was a typo in the update_tasks for Manila which was causing
updates and upgrades to fail. This patch fixes the typo.

Closes-Bug: 1775667

Change-Id: I88dd16fa94111a4eb56aeaa32b560cf7d12b9f82
(cherry picked from commit 5e3d90f851230c5d0489c16b68d09ddace29da8b)
(cherry picked from commit 38019bed913383192759acf4e596f7aa031e2e06)

(9 comments)

A few different issues noted with.

Two overarching concerns:

* Not clear why the report client changes are in this patch.
* The generation handling, as noted in the earlier patches is only addressing one of the two concerns that we need to worry about with generations.

The concern that it does address is about the incoming generation not matching the stored generation, indicating that the client had stale info.


What it does not address is the case where the generation has changed out from under the in-progress transaction.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-04-30 22:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-30 22:16:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Add a microversion for consumer generation

The previous patch added the 'generation' field to the consumer table.
This patch adds microversion 1.99 for handling that in requests as well
as including its values in any returned allocations.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: Ib917d33f37872c2143d962a0c1e2893bbce0fdef

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/564641/1/ : SUCCESS in 3h 36m 57s'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-04-30 15:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As I mentioned on the consumer object patch, I don't see why we need or want to add the "enforce" flag thing to the object layer. I feel that kind of thing should be in the handler layer. For example, in set_allocations() (which is the only place we would be enforcing consumer generations), verify that the generation for the consumer has been supplied, do a read of the existing consumer information, and simply return a 409 Conflict if the generation doesn't match.

If it does match, set the consumer's generation in the Allocation object (if you really don't want to use a Consumer object) and when set, ensure that you increment the generation at the end of set_allocations().'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-04-30 17:11:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Jay - in the object layer, we need to know whether a generation mis-match should be ignored (old microversions) or rejected (new) For older microversions, the consumer record is created / updated irrespective of any record that may exist. For example:

Two requests for allocations for the same consumer are received using an old microversion. This is the race condition that prompted this series. The handler layer will pass those to the objects, with a value of None for the consumer_generation. The first request to be processed will create the consumer record, with a value of zero. How will the object layer know what to do with the second request? It *should* overwrite the first requests allocations, because that is the current behavior. So it needs to know if it should reject that second request or not. It's possible to put it on the AllocationList object instead of the individual Allocation object, but it's gotta be somewhere."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-04-30 22:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-30 23:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-17557 : SUCCESS in 1h 12m 06s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-05-01 00:35:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/564641/2/ : FAILURE in 2h 22m 23s'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-06-11 19:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Such a waste.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-26 22:40:29.000000000', 'message': "WIP - Add consumer generation checking logic

This patch avoids the creation of a Consumer object, and instead adds
the logic in the Allocation class. It feels to me to be much simpler and
direct than in the object approach. Posting here to get some feedback so
that reviewers can compare the two approaches.

No behaviors are changed in this patch; if it is found to be preferable
to the Consumer object approach, I'll apply the microversion patch on
top of this.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: I4f8a743cd73ed97468869381010d27df3a10beff
"}, {'created': '2018-04-30 22:12:04.000000000', 'message': 'Add consumer generation checking logic

Logic to check and increment the consumer_generation for allocations is
added in this patch. No behaviors are changed in this patch; that is
handled in a subsequent patch that bumps the microversion.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: I4f8a743cd73ed97468869381010d27df3a10beff
'}]
commit_message:
Add consumer generation checking logic

Logic to check and increment the consumer_generation for allocations is
added in this patch. No behaviors are changed in this patch; that is
handled in a subsequent patch that bumps the microversion.

Blueprint: add-consumer-generation

Change-Id: I4f8a743cd73ed97468869381010d27df3a10beff

commit_message:
Cleanup pre transform and transform specs

* Removed unused fields "event_status", "event_version",
  "record_type", "mount", "device", "pod_name", "container_name"
  "app", "interface", "deployment" and "daemon_set"
   from record_store data. Now it is not required to add
  new dimension, meta or value_meta fields to record store data
  instead use special notation, e.g. "dimension#" to refer to any
  dimension field in the incoming metric.

* Refactor and eliminate need to add any new metric.dimensions
  field in multiple places e.g. add to record store and
  instance usage dataframe schema and in all generic
  aggregation components. Added a new Map type column
  called "extra_data_map" to store any new fields, in
  instance usage data format. Map type column eliminates the
  need to add new columns to instance usage data.

* Allow users to define any fields in  "meta",
  "metric.dimensions" and "metric.value_meta" fields
  for aggregation in "aggregation_group_by_list" or
  "setter_group_by_list" using "dimensions#{$field_name}"
  or "meta#{$field_name}" or "value_meta#{$field_name}"

* Updated generic aggregation components and data formats docs.

Change-Id: I81a35e048e6bd5649c6b3031ac2722be6a309088
Story: 2001815
Task: 19605

messages:
[{'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-04-18 15:19:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-04-18 15:38:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5575, 'date': '2018-04-19 05:55:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27060, 'date': '2018-04-23 13:47:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:03:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

Spec looks good, and the use case seems valid, although probably not many customers face it, so I'm not too convinced that the benefits of the feature outweigh the possible confusion and issues of customers that enable this and then have weird behavior on the scheduler."}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-04-24 06:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-04-24 06:55:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Thanks for the review, Gorka. I applied the changes you suggested.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-04-24 06:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-04-24 07:52:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Thanks for making the changes, the spec looks good to me in itself.  As I mentioned probably not many customers would require this feature, and I'm afraid the possible confusion with the scheduler's behavior when using it may outweigh the benefits.

I won't oppose the feature, but I won't push for it either."}, {'account_id': 23083, 'date': '2018-04-24 12:36:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-04-25 18:16:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-25 19:58:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)

I do think this is something other backends may want to take advantage of. But rather than expanding the scope of this spec, I wonder if we can just change the config options to be generic common options that other driver maintainers can choose to implement support for.

I just don't want to end up with a whole set of x_enable_deferred_delete, y_enabled_deferred_delete, etc."}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-04-25 21:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Eric, Sean, thanks for your input!

Eric:
What triggers get_volume_stats(), and what controls its frequency?
On what condition would you create the purge thread, backend fill status maybe?
I had in mind to purge quite often and remove images beyond expiry, would that be the idea for your suggestion as well (rather than having a real trigger)?

Sean:
Happy to drop rbd_ if that is acceptable :)
Agreed we would not need that third option if get_volume_stats() either runs regularly and/or with a controllable frequency.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-05-01 20:12:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

All-in-all this looks good.  I am supportive of this.  Just need some additional based on the comments.'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-05-02 14:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Need to describe how purging will be triggered.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-05-03 10:43:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-05-03 12:15:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-05-03 18:15:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-05-04 09:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11292, 'date': '2018-05-04 09:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-05-04 09:35:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-05-04 09:39:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2018-05-07 08:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-06-11 18:51:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks for putting this together Arne.  Looks good.'}]

commit_message:
Support deferred deletion in the RBD driver

This spec proposes to add configurable support for deferred
deletion in the RBD driver, using RBD's trash_* API calls
introduced with the Luminous release of Ceph.

As this not intended for the rocky release, the commit also
creates the stein folder.

Change-Id: If10cf310dd574bedb576f06a30fe81c50c4b8844
Implements: bp rbd-deferred-volume-deletion

commit_message:
Allow integration of externally deployed RadosGW

The variable ceph_rgws can be overridden by the deployer to supply
a list of externally provisioned RadosGW isntances. This will
trigger Keystone endpoint setup tasks and integrate the RadosGW
servers with HAProxy.

Change-Id: I46ffc0f8956d0ebc7fcd294ad9c2b376589e1e9b

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Idf7736fb455d0a13da5a8b6140f5eaa7fa44cb99
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

Export OS_CACERT after sourcing .stackenv file

This makes sure that it is available to subprocesses like the other
authentication data.

Closes-Bug: 1760901

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 14:18:03.000000000', 'message': "Fix interpretation of max_attempts for scheduling alternates

Since max_attempts is not max_retries, we should look for max_attempts-1
alternate hosts. This change makes the num_alts variable actually reflect
the number of alternates we are looking for, and doesn't actually change
the logic at all. This also adds functional tests to verify max_attempts
behavior with 1 (no retries) and 2 (one retry), just to make sure it is
doing what we expect.

Further, we optimize _get_alternate_hosts() to only re-filter/weigh the
host list if we're looking for alternates for multiple instances. Now
that it's clear that num_alts is only nonzero if we are going to look
at the host list again to find those alternates, it can be more clearly
(and accurately) used to optimize out that extra step if we are not
getting alternates.

Closes-Bug: #1775625
Change-Id: I16ba29385dd2db5467829e6c17fc395096b5cfd3
(cherry picked from commit 5d86aa7edb60ec35fa43c670ae1f0513dc1e9ad5)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix interpretation of max_attempts for scheduling alternates

Since max_attempts is not max_retries, we should look for max_attempts-1
alternate hosts. This change makes the num_alts variable actually reflect
the number of alternates we are looking for, and doesn't actually change
the logic at all. This also adds functional tests to verify max_attempts
behavior with 1 (no retries) and 2 (one retry), just to make sure it is
doing what we expect.

Further, we optimize _get_alternate_hosts() to only re-filter/weigh the
host list if we're looking for alternates for multiple instances. Now
that it's clear that num_alts is only nonzero if we are going to look
at the host list again to find those alternates, it can be more clearly
(and accurately) used to optimize out that extra step if we are not
getting alternates.

Closes-Bug: #1775625
Change-Id: I16ba29385dd2db5467829e6c17fc395096b5cfd3
(cherry picked from commit 5d86aa7edb60ec35fa43c670ae1f0513dc1e9ad5)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We can't set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36 due to https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/425

Change-Id: Ibeb97401c13fb1cb35f824082eb6b3209c868beb

commit_message:
Dell EMC PS: Fix the driver path

The Dell EMC PS driver's path
cinder.volume.drivers.eqlx.DellEQLSanISCSIDriver is deprecated,
update to new path
cinder.volume.drivers.dell_emc.ps.PSSeriesISCSIDriver

Closes Bug: #1758133

Change-Id: Ia676610fc22da31202133497b7ed0fae66e7ac1c

commit_message:
Ensure resource class cache when listing usages

In rare circumstances it is possible to list usages in a new placement
process that has not yet instantiated the _RC_CACHE but for which
there are inventories and allocations in the database (added by
other processes running against the same db). Before this change
that would cause a 500 error (AttributeError) when the Usage objects
in the UsageList were instantiated.

The fix is to added _ensure_rc_cache to the two list methods. The
addition is done there rather than in the _from_db_object as the
latter would cause a lot of redundant checks.

While we could probably devise a test for this, it's perhaps good
enough to evaluate the change by inspection. If not, suggestions
welcome.

Change-Id: I00f7dee26f031366dbc0d3d6a03abe89afeb85fd
Closes-Bug: #1775308
(cherry picked from commit 724d440122232a5bfdfec51eb0d37ca4f1d748d8)

[{'created': '2018-06-11 17:14:24.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia4d5692902d065ff3761b14d44a9e38815bc579f
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia4d5692902d065ff3761b14d44a9e38815bc579f

'}, {'created': '2018-06-06 15:32:28.000000000', 'message': 'Set format options when prepairing filesystems

we support. This change implements a hash to capture many of the
different options we use throughout a test deployment.

* BTRFS: set metadata for test volumes to single.

  the metadata on our loopback devices was defaulting the the file-system

commit_message:
Set format options when prepairing filesystems

Various options are available when formatting the different file systems
we support. This change implements a hash to capture many of the
different options we use throughout a test deployment.

* BTRFS: set metadata for test volumes to single.

  the metadata on our loopback devices was defaulting the the file-system
  default of DUP (duplicate) which is reasonable on a production
  deployment however on a loopback device it makes more sense to set the
  data and metadata options to "single". This will help eliminate the
  issues were seeing with intermittently full file-systems.

* XFS: set block sizes, placement groups, and do not issue discards at
       create.

  This will speed up the time it takes to format an XFS partition as
  well as ensure things remain speedy under load.

* EXT4: speed up directory lookups

  Use hashed b-trees to speed up name lookups in large directories.

Change-Id: I004768d98da194cc90b36cdf72dbf75b24a661a2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Allow detail pages to auto refresh upon action

[{'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-04-15 12:14:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-04-15 12:19:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is no good way to auto refresh tables, no event leaked from horizon.

The brute force way is to use a exponential backoff to update the table reguarly.

So that hopefully would be resolved by horizon and then we can reuse.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-04-15 12:27:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-04-16 08:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-04-16 08:18:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-04-16 08:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

This works well for me. My only concern is the delay between updates is way too long. Having dashboard trail reality by a minute gives a poor user experience.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-05-15 18:49:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-05-16 13:36:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-05-16 19:35:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+2

Works for me.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-05-22 21:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11: Code-Review+1

ok, I installed it and it refreshes immediately when I take an action (e.g. change pool from round-robin to least-connections) BUT then the pool is in pending_update and it only yes to ACTIVE when I change the tab to listener and then back. I observed the same with listener. Is this not covered by this patch?'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-05-23 02:04:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

> ok, I installed it and it refreshes immediately when I take an
 > action (e.g. change pool from round-robin to least-connections) BUT
 > then the pool is in pending_update and it only yes to ACTIVE when I
 > change the tab to listener and then back. I observed the same with
 > listener. Is this not covered by this patch?

It took some time to get the latest status, I guess you do not switch tabs and just wait a while, the state also get updated.

It works like when user does nothing, the page refresh at a regular interval of 5 seconds.

When there are some user activity, the refresh timer gets reset to 250 ms and does a expoential backoff until it reaches 5 seconds.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-05-23 04:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2018-05-23 04:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

Alright, I did some refinement on the refresh logic of detail pages that has children listed in tabs.

So now the children are updated together with the parent, this should reduce the number of http requests.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2018-06-11 17:01:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2

Works in testing for me and looks good, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2018-06-11 17:05:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia156a087ff8f04307f255e61f3f2e9ffdae42861
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

This release includes a number of bug fixes as
well as the additions to support availability_zones
for the backup service and the ability to filters on

commit_message:
Switch to oslo_messaging.ConfFixture.transport_url

oslo_messaging's rpc_backend setting, which is set by
ConfFixture.transport_driver has been deprecated since Newton. To allow
oslo_messaging to remove it, switch to setting transport_url instead.

Change-Id: I8ac08a2f966356f14f89c109dbfa0a66c258e939
Partial-Bug: #1712399

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia069985b92af920970af9e84d37e27ddc8625437
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I0637976fc3097ff5052e38cf8a9afc7a3330034f
Depends-On: I2cbf2e63a9d93c232b6928acf002a45b7fbcec8e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
[Trivialfix] Remove the useless parameter 'ext_mgr'

The parameter 'ext_mgr' is not used in method _setup_routes() in
subclasses:
manila.api.v2/router.APIRouter
manila.api.v1.router.APIRouter
manila.api.versions.VersionsRouter
So it should be removed to make the code clean.

The superclass of them is manila.api.openstack.__init__.APIRouter,
the 'ext_mgr' is removed from method _setup_routers() in superclass.

In method__init__() in superclass, the _setup_routers() is called,
so 'ext_mgr'is removed in related calling statement.

Change-Id: I25e2d5447b328c88c660ae17025f65719290b21b
